text: Cute place with friendly owner.  We sampled the black sesame and ordered the ube.  Both were very good.

text:
Hands down, the best soft serve ice cream I've ever had in my entire life!!!! I love anything taro flavor, so I had to get the "ube-be-baby." I wasn't sure how I would feel about the cake since ice cream is already sweet itself, but the vanilla cake was sooo complimentary to the ube flavor. It was perfection!  definitely my new go-to dessert spot!

Update: came back and tried the vanilla + black sesame combo and O. M. G. that was just as delicious as the Ube! Another favorite!
name: KRĒM
categories: Restaurants, Creperies, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Food

text: Matcha and black sesame ice cream was pretty good but the cake was dry. Looks instagram worthy but you gotta eat a lot of the ice cream before you get to the cake. A-ok!

text: Wow! This place is excellent! I love the flavors and often get two in a swirl, like red bean and black sesame. Reno is starting to feel like a real city now, even though it's still small! I've been to Krem a bunch and every time, the staff are really friendly. Make sure to ask for a taste of a new flavor if they don't already offer it to you, which they tend to do! My only wish is they had larger containers with lids to get it to go!

categories: Restaurants, Creperies, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Food

text: This is a cute trendy place, their soft serve is pretty good. Try their Thai tea or black sesame!

text: LOVE This place! This was our last stop of our vacation on the way to the airport and I'm so glad we fit it in! The owner was very friendly and the store was adorable. He gave us samples and even took some pictures of us with our ice cream! The matcha and black sesame were equally delicious. The music and vibe of the place was also very fun. I'd definitely come back!
name: KRĒM
categories: Restaurants, Creperies, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Food

text: I've always hear good things about this place from my friends and figured I'd give it a try. The first thing that caught my eye were the unique flavors you could choose from - ube, black sesame, matcha. If you don't like anything super sweet, I would recommend the black sesame or matcha. The place itself is small and there's cards if you want to play games. It's a little proceed for the soft serve, about $7 and you can add pocky for another thirty cents. Overall, the place was clean and can be a good hangout for groups.
name: KRĒM
categories: Restaurants, Creperies, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Food

text: Totally WORTH THE PRICE! Super nice worker and atmosphere. I've had matcha, Ube, and black sesame ice cream in other places (Vegas and San Francisco) and Krēm's beats everybody's! Best desert spot in town
name: KRĒM
categories: Restaurants, Creperies, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Food

text: Service is amazing and so is the ice cream! I think the black sesame is my favorite flavor but really they are all so good. I had the #1 with the matcha flavor. I will be back to get every flavor, haha!
name: KRĒM
categories: Restaurants, Creperies, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Food

text:
This was one of my fav memory about Reno!! This place is awesome, it's aesthetically pleasing, it will satisfy your instagram dreams & your tastebuds! 
We tried the black sesame with chocolate cake which was absolutely DELICIOUS! The cake was BOMB like actually good quality cake & it paired so well w the black sesame. As for the Matcha we paired it w/ the vanilla cake w strategy sauce & it was also a HIT, the strawberry paired w the matcha was BOMB, it had real pieces of strawberry which added a nice touch. Your tastebuds will definitely be pleased. As for customer service, they were super nice & super helpful, we took a while to choose because it was our first time & they were great tie breakers. Great place to get good ice cream & chill.
name: KRĒM
categories: Restaurants, Creperies, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Food

text:
This cute little shop has the best aesthetic and even better soft serve! I loved my match swirl with vanilla cake and condensed milk. I really want to try the black sesame seed flavor next.
I went late on a Sunday night and it was very busy, but it seems like on slower days it would be a good place to sit and chat with a friend or read a book while eating delicious ice cream!
name: KRĒM
categories: Restaurants, Creperies, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Food

text:
I really wished I'd had a better food experience. Most everything else about Milk and Honey was enjoyable. Perhaps I bear some of the blame for coming here for dinner rather than breakfast/brunch? Maybe I should have began my relationship with M&H by focusing on its strengths? I dunno.

Despite all the fanfare around the opening, I hadn't been in a rush to come to M&H. I'm not the sort to automatically discount chains but I do like to give the local counterparts my initial attention. Add to this the fact that I don't get to The Gulch that often* and M&H fell further and further down my list. But after a night of wondering around the neighborhood, my buddy got hungry and suggested we check it out. He'd been to M&H before and was a fan. So, off we went.

First thing I noticed was the build out. It's impressive. A deft use of indoor/outdoor space, the color black and good lighting makes one want to spend time here. The next thing I noticed: the employees were all really kind. From the gent who showed us to our table, to our waitress, to the manager, to the food runner... everyone was authentically engaging and not nice for nice's sake. It was almost shocking. A sad commentary, I know. Things were headed in a good direction. I pumped the brakes on the vibes by telling my waitress about my tricky gut and gluten issues. I told her it wasn't a huge deal and I would get a salad if a plate of food wasn't an option. She asked the kitchen and came back to tell me about my options. It worked in my favor because my eye was on the Cali Grilled Chicken and it was safe for me to eat!

When the plate arrived at the table... I was disappointed. To my mind, the description didn't live up to the execution. The first disappointment was the presentation. For a plate that reads 'Grilled chicken breast, avocado, sweet potato, brown rice, black sesame, beet, pickled red onion, garlic, kale, feta, white bean purée, carrot, buttermilk cucumber sauce, and chili', I was a bit shocked at how pedestrian everything looked. 'Hospital cafeteria' came to mind. But, the aroma was nice and food is to be eaten, not Instagrammed so I pressed on. I took a bite and... okay. It was okay. Honestly, I found the plate a bit boring and under seasoned. For so many bold flavors (on the page), I didn't understand how 'meh' it tasted in my mouth. Not finding success with the dry components, I mixed everything together and topped the plate with the three accompanying sauces (coconut-chili, another chili and, I think, a lime juice). By then the plate looked *really* unappealing but it tasted better.

Maybe breakfast/brunch is the better call?

*Although lately I have been there a lot!
name: Milk and Honey Nashville

text:
Very rarely do sushi restaurants impress because good sushi is simply good fish. Many places try to stand out with creative specialty rolls, but they often try too hard and go overboard. But none of this is the case at Izumi. 

We came in for date night during East Passyunk Restaurant Week, so this review is for that menu. Upon stepping in, there's definitely a very intimate feel with the dim lights, sleek furniture and votive candles. Thankfully, we made a reservation and were seated right away at the bar, which was great because there is zero standing room in this cozy spot (which we overheard someone complain about on the way out). 

For the first course, we chose then crab spring rolls and pork belly starters. The long crab spring rolls were uniquely wrapped in seaweed and then a dough wrapper. They were accompanied by spicy mayo and citrusy avocado sauces. The pork belly was deliciously glazed and flavorful, served atop Japanese risotto that resembled creamy polenta with a couple of sliced mushrooms thrown in. 

Next was a sushi sampling that was well-presented and consisted of tuna dressed in a sauce with like zest, a whitefish (I believe) with a black sesame sauce, and salmon with a sweet foam. The first two were delicious and creative without being over-the-top, while I was not a fan of the overly sweet foam on the salmon. We both agreed that the black sesame was our favorite part. 

The third course is a shrimp and asparagus tempura maki roll with lightly seared salmon and wasabi aioli on top. It's not really fancy, but it really exceeded our expectations. The plump shrimp was cooked well, and the asparagus is a nice touch. We were skeptical of the cooked salmon as part of a roll, but it was sooo good! 

Dessert was a dish of cinnamon sugar donuts and salted caramel dipping sauce. It was kind of an afterthought for me, but it was still good. 

The service was friendly and never too overbearing. We liked watching the steady (and very calm) action at the kitchen. Can't wait to return and try some of their regular menu.
name: Izumi

text: Came here after dinner for the first time and was surprised how much I really enjoyed the UBE Black Sesame flavor. I never knew this place existed when driving by. It is small place but clean and bright. The worker was really nice, totally positive and all smiles. He encouraged us to try the flavors that we're available and even stated that a new flavor inspired my a Mexican desert will be available soon and it sounded really good. The cake and sauce that comes with the soft serve was very delicious and moist. They also have some board games onsite if you decide to stay and hang out.

text:
Embarrassed to say that we actually drove 60+ mile RT to have this treat. It was in the afternoon before 3 pm.  I had called before heading to Reno to make sure that the limited 4 flavors were available.  We got there and several people were going in.  We were being polite in our masks/social distancing but a couple families stepped in front of us. No big deal, we can wait.  Got in and able to order.  They only had three flavors and one was vanilla... After making the Ube sundae, we noticed that there was NO CAKE.  Out of cake?! THAT was the deal, fun flavor, cake, topping...  We asked about the cake.  Out of the cake.  "Do you want a topping" (that is supposed to go on the cake btw)  Ok.  As an ant walked across the sundae cup, he poured on some evaporated milk, flicking off the ant.  He handed it to us. We paid $5.74 (full price for the cake sundae) for some soft serve, (the soft serve was hollow... you know, not all soft serve - which might be ok if there had been cake inside the void) not the flavor we wanted Black Sesame; without the cake that had and ant flicked off! 
Maybe they could have placed a notice on the door that said NO CAKE and the flavors still in stock. Kind of a waste of time, waiting for others after driving over 40 minutes then disappointment with the no-cake-included treat that we paid full price for
name: KRĒM
categories: Restaurants, Creperies, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Food

text: This was my second time visiting Krēm, and to my surprise they were serving black sesame soft serve! A very welcome surprise, as I was hoping they'd add the flavor to the menu since it's one of my favorites. It has a nice, nutty flavor, and isn't overly sweet, and in it's curated sundae form (adorably named "The Penguin") it had a nice balance of flavors. Both times I visited, the staff were super nice, coming around to ask us how our ice cream was and making sure we were having a good time. Definitely a place Reno needed!
name: KRĒM
categories: Restaurants, Creperies, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Food

text: Love this place. Especially their soft serve ice KRĒM. Had a match and black sesame swirl with white ganache crumble. Hubby got Ube drizzled with condense milk. Baby girl got Triple vanilla with strawberry sauce. Soo good must come back for more.

text:
Great additional to Reno. The owner/worker was super friendly and was eager to offer samples of their flavors.   
I personally love Ube but didn't really feel like the Ube was that strong. Matcha and black sesame were good. We resorted to black sesame with vanilla cake and condense milk. It's a great combo but I think it would taste better if the cake was sprinkled on the top or of it was layered on. It was hard to eat all the soft serve on top first and then eat all the cake on the bottom. 

Overall, $4.80 by itself or $6.80 with cake. Give them a try if you like unique asian flavor soft serve!
name: KRĒM
categories: Restaurants, Creperies, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Food

text: I found this Ice Cream shop from Youtube and was intrigue. I love ice cream...who doesn't. They have 4 different soft serve flavours and I was able to try all 4 before choosing. I ended up ordering the Ube/Matcha combination. It was very delicious. The other 2 flavours Milo and a cereal version was good too. Since it was my first time at Yelo'd I opted for just the soft serve. However, they have many unique cookies as well and I had to also purchase the black sesame/chocolate chip cookie. Yes I was a pig! But I live in Toronto and I don't know when I'll ever come back. They do make really good cookies. If I ever come back I would get their ice cream sandwiches. Overall, this is a great Ice Cream shop on Whyte Ave. Hopefully I could come back someday.
name: Yelo'd Ice Cream
categories: Food, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt, Bakeries

text:
I LOVE the flavors offered here. They had matcha, ube, vanilla, and Thai tea soft cream. The matcha flavor is very strong and actually tastes like matcha; not like the sugar bombs you would get at a sushi ayce. Their flavors rotate and I cannot wait to go back when the black sesame is offered. 

We got a matcha and ube swirl with vanilla cake and red bean sauce. My favorite part is that the whole sundae was not overwhelmingly sweet. I can taste each individual flavor and it was absolutely delicious. The price is a little high, but we thought it was perfect for sharing. 

The owner was super friendly and let us taste the flavors. He let us know about the process of creating his flavors. Would definitely be back when new flavors are available!
name: KRĒM
categories: Restaurants, Creperies, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Food

text:
We finally have something new in Reno! This dessert shop is definitely instagram worthy, from their cute neon sign, to their presentation of the desserts. This is definitely a place for my Instagram foodies! 

I mean, let's be real, who doesn't love cake and ice cream?! However, this place definitely takes it to a whole new level. Their soft serve are Asian inspired so they have choices such as matcha, ube, and their newest flavor, black sesame. If you want more basic flavors, they also have your classic vanilla and chocolate. My favorite is their Ube soft serve paired with vanilla cake, drizzled with condensed milk.
name: KRĒM
categories: Restaurants, Creperies, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Food

text: Looooove the matcha ice cream with red bean sauce!! The customer service was excellent. Hoping to try the black sesame next time. The whole family loved it.

text: We arrived around 2:30pm on a Saturday and it was pretty busy, but there were still tables available. We ordered the #2 ube-be baby, #3 the Sunday, #4 the penguin. Overall, the ice cream was okay. It's a little icy and I wish it was creamier. Out of the three that we got, enjoyed the penguin the most. The black sesame had good flavor without being too sweet. The vanilla in the Sunday tasted exactly like McDonald's soft serve, except a little sweeter. I didn't enjoy how the cake was at the bottom of the cup and ice cream on top. I might've looked nice, but I couldn't enjoy them both together. We ended up asking for a cup and scooping out the ice cream.

text:
Very fresh flavors and unique. Asian inspired company and ice cream. Limited flavors but they have the standard vanilla. 

It's a standard price 6.80 per serving, mix and match on your toppings if you like or go with their paired suggestions.   

I did like the unique factor. Black Sesame as an example, different for sure. If you want to try something different, go here it's worth a visit.

text:
Such a great addition to Reno! The owner is very friendly. During my first visit, he was kind enough to explain the ice cream flavors and what inspired him to make them. The inside is very cute and totally instagram worthy. The soft serve ice cream itself is always on point. What I appreciate about the ice cream here is that it's not overly sweet. I absolutely love the different flavors. 

I do not enjoy the cake though. It is a bit dry and doesn't really compliment the ice cream in my opinion but that's why I get it without the cake now. 

My favorite flavors are the black sesame, Thai tea, and ube. Once the owner mentioned something about a mango lassi flavor so I am definitely looking forward to that. Can't wait to see what other flavors are added!
name: KRĒM
categories: Restaurants, Creperies, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Food

text:
This place definitely has a hipster vibe and I've been coming here a lot to taste all the flavors!

First of all, service has always been great here! The servers and owners always greet their customers upon entrance and also check on them. This place is relatively new and has great potential to grow. Parking is not bad, but the location can be easy to miss because it is located on a heavily trafficked area. 

The place is 5/5 on cleanliness and 5/5 on interior design. They also have a few small board games including UNO, miniature Connect 4 and 2 decks of regular playing cards.

Most importantly the ice cream.
I've gone here three times and so far, all my experiences have been great! I've played around with the menu a lot and I can say I have my favorites down. 
So what to get?
You can get just soft serve if you want with whichever flavor you want. They do switch out flavors though and only four flavors at a time are available. They do have combinations of soft serve, cake and sauce to choose from but you can also customize you're order. So basically pick your ice cream flavor, pick a cake, pick a sauce and you get an option to add pocky for an additional $0.60.

1st visit: I got matcha and ube swirl with vanilla cake and Red bean sauce with cookies n' cream 
2nd visit: I got Black Sesame Ice cream. (Forgot what cake and sauce)
3rd visit: I got pumpkin spice and vanilla swirl with vanilla cake with chocolate ganache and chocolate pocky. My friends got Matcha with vanilla cake and condensed milk with strawberry pocky.

So far my favorite has been my third visit. I enjoyed the pumpkin spice and matcha a lot! Although on every visit, I noticed that the cakes were quite dry. I felt it needed more of a moister cake or more sauce, one or the other. I didn't enjoy the red bean sauce too much becuase it was a little too concentrated for me, but I did enjoy the chocolate ganache a lot! Their matcha soft serve has the perfect concentration of matcha--it isn't too concentrated (which is what I was expecting). I also enjoyed the black sesame soft serve because it wasn't overpowering at all. On my next visit I want to try the Ube-Baby-Baby (I think that's what it was called).

They used to use plastic to put the ice cream and cake in and now they use paper cups. I personally like this better because I can reach for the cake with sauce much faster. I do enjoy the ice cream a lot, but I personally want to eat them all at once. With the plastic ones I had to finish the ice cream first before I got to the cake and sauce. 

I do wish sauce was added to the ice cream and had more toppings, but overall I do think this place is still pretty awesome!
name: KRĒM
categories: Restaurants, Creperies, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Food

text:
A friend of mine brought me here while I was visiting her family in St. Peters, and it was all that she described and more! We sampled a few macarons (black sesame, red velvet and I think hazelnut...) and they were all very tasty. I also ordered a pain au chocolat and a latte, and my friend ordered a tiramisu brownie, and everything was delightful.

I knew that my boyfriend would love The Darkness croissant and he also loves toffee, so I picked those up to take home. They were kind enough to double wrap the croissant for my trip back, and I kept it frozen until we ate it. It was a great item to share- it's so rich. We also like that the toffee is tasty and does not feel like you're going to break your teeth, lol. I will definitely go back whenever I am in the area!
name: La Patisserie Chouquette

text:
I am a sucker for IG-worthy desserts (Don't judge me - technically I'm a millennial so can't help it) and adore soft serve so when traveling through Reno, KRĒM stood out as the best spot for a post-dinner treat. The idea is simple: Clear plastic cones filled with cake and sauce, topped with a tall swirl of ice cream. Their menu lists four curated options, or you can put together your own custom treat. There are four flavors of ice cream (I think this may change, but on our visit, it was matcha, ube, vanilla, and black sesame), vanilla or chocolate cake, and four sauces: strawberry, chocolate ganache, sweetened condensed milk, and red bean. 

My hubby kept it simple, ordering "I Love You So Matcha" off the "pre-set" menu. I like to make things complicated, so put together my own: chocolate cake and ganache + ube and black sesame swirl. They offer to add Pocky sticks but I declined....why?! Though they were consistently busy, orders were prepared within no more than five minutes. Conveniently, they are served with a spoon, so you can dig down past the ice cream into the cake and eat it all together. The cake was basic, but good. Fairly moist, with large crumb. My ganache sort of melded into the cake, so it was difficult to try it separately, but nothing tasted artificial, so I'm happy with that. I wasn't sure what my husband would think of the red beans, but he liked them! For the ice cream, matcha is not shy AT ALL - it is green and grassy, and if you love that tea, you'll be all about it. I found it a tad overwhelming for my taste, but again, it was natural, so no complaints. The black sesame ice cream was my favorite. It was sweeter than I imagined, with none of the bitter notes (that I enjoy!) usually accompanying sesame, but it did have good nutty flavor. The color is a stunning dark grey. Ube had no noticeable flavor beyond "sweet," but again, killing it in the color department with that vibrant purple. My one complaint: The ice cream almost hardened on the outside. Not unforgivably icy, but also not luscious and rich, almost like it had a base made entirely of milk or with added water. 

The interior is small, but there is enough seating for 15 or so people. It was clean, with self-serve water available. Employees were sweet as can be. At just under $7 per cone for good, if not stupendous ice cream, just own up to the fact that you want a cool IG photo (can't beat the "I licked it so it's mine" neon sign), and you still get a pretty decent dessert out of it, too.
name: KRĒM
categories: Restaurants, Creperies, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Food

text: I love their black sesame ice cream! I think they had it for a short period of time. It was different but good! Their Ive and green tea ice cream is a must to try when you go to this place. Although it's a little pricey for an ice cream, I think it's worth the price since matcha is expensive. Customer service is excellent as well.
name: KRĒM
categories: Restaurants, Creperies, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Food

text:
Saturday Sweetness

Food

Black Sesame, Matcha, Ube!? It was a little different than your typical visit to Dairy Queen, but real good.

I opted for the Matcha / Ube swirl with, Vanilla Cake, drizzled with Condensed Milk. And to top it all off, Pocky. Because I was feeling a little extra that night, I opted to get them all. Cookies and Cream, Chocolate, Strawberry, and Matcha.

Service

By chance I got the opportunity to meet one of the owners, Casey. He took the time to let my girlfriend and I ask all of our curious questions and sample every flavor available before we made our selection. 

I would reccomend this place to anyone looking for a light sweet treat.
name: KRĒM
categories: Restaurants, Creperies, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Food

text:
As a poor college student, "luxury" ice cream isn't really something I can get on the regular, but when I'm craving it, KRĒM is always my first choice! The soft serve flavors are incredibly well balanced and not too overwhelming while also maintaining a smooth and creamy texture. The real secret of KRĒM though is mixing your soft serve into the cake; you never realize how great the combo is until you mix it together. 
On top of the quality of the food, the staff is always incredibly friendly and I'm always greeted happily whenever I go in with friends or family! 
You have a wonderful staff and environment with good ice cream all for an extremely reasonable price! If you love asian inspired flavors (ube, green tea, black sesame), then KRĒM is the perfect ice cream shop for you!
name: KRĒM
categories: Restaurants, Creperies, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Food

text:
From the cute decorations inside, to the amazing flavors, to the customer service, KRĒM exceeds my expectations of ANY ice cream or frozen yogurt shop. 

You've probably seen Instagram pictures of their notorious "I licked it so it's mine" neon sign, which is most certainly one of the best backdrops for an ice cream picture ever. But besides the aesthetics, when me and my boyfriend came into the shop we were greeted with very cheery faces. I felt so welcomed and excited to be getting a delicious treat! The owner was working, and he greeted us with samples of the Black Sesame flavor. It's a very interesting taste, and not really my cup of tea, however I'm sure that other people would like it. Personally, I loved the Ube and Matcha flavors - sooooo good! While we waited for our orders to be made, the owner chatted it up with us (he's super nice!). 

There's so much more I could say about this place. Overall, I loved it and highly suggest you go try it out :)
name: KRĒM
categories: Restaurants, Creperies, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Food

text:
I came here twice in one week because it was so yummy. You can't go wrong with ice cream and cake especially when it's in a cute presented really pretty! its simple- pick your cake (chocolate or vanilla), ice cream ( green tea, taro, black sesame), and syrup (condensed milk, chocolate, strawberry). Highly recommend giving this place a shot!

PS the only bummer part is that its a bit difficult to scoop the ice cream and cake in the cup.
name: KRĒM
categories: Restaurants, Creperies, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Food

text:
First off I love their carson location and I think this might have even been tastier!!!!!! 

Yelp 25 % off ayce with yelp check in, score!!!!

The inside is so pretty and well decorated, and I love the location! It's so so so close to my condo, and traders Joe's where I shop.

So after mom and I went to traders we squeezed in during the last 30 minutes till close, and they were totally cool about it. I recognized the owner from the carson location in the back.

The rolls omg just that perfect thin layer to cover but not over shadow the seaweed and fish, stick and sweet and tangy (rice white vinegar and sugar, held together seamlessly on all the rolls.

Mom ordered the Fuji and said the raw fish was some of the freshest she has had anywhere local, including minatio and hinko. The shrimp inside had a lovely crunch with out being too oily.

I order three rolls and loved the presentation on all of them as well as the spicy level.

The cici with no salmon (they were totally cool about it too) had wicked hot white sauce on it spicier than sriracha, but I loved it!!! The scallops were super fresh and the other tangy sauce paired nicely with the ripe avocado and the cream cheese was a needed to balance out the spice level. 

The moon dog poppers had crunch jalapeño with the seeds taken out so it was much less spicy than the other roll, paired well with spicy crab and a crispy tempura case, and cream cheese filled innards.

Then the two next rolls were sooooo artistically done both my mom and I were taken back. Plated on craved wood the sauce designs were truly magical as you can see in the pictures!!! 

The volcano had the delicately fried out side, and was pipping hot, with the soft eggy sweet tamago inside and huge sweet scallops on top with a spice sauce and sauce all around the plate to drag through. 

The samurai was prob my fav. The huge chunks of pecans were such a lovely bit of nutty texture, to the cream cheese and fluffy fried shrimp, topped with again huge chunky scallops and black sesame seeds with 2 creamy spice sauces. Then again plated like a a piece from a museum!!

I can't not wait to go back and try more of the unique rolls and see the art they dish up.
name: Kei Sushi

text:
Only place I could find in the area that has ube soft serve!!!!

Conveniently located across the street from the Atlantis Tesla chargers, so we can park the car and walk over for some dessert :P

They rotate flavors, with only about 3 - 4 different ones per day.
It's not like your standard froyo place, so don't expect the typical flavors or a huge selection.

They have flavors like ube, horchata, matcha, and black sesame, and you have the option to have it over some cake!

I went with just the soft serve since we had AYCE KBBQ right before, and it was delicious! so we'll definitely be back for more!

Small parking lot in front, friendly employees, Instagrammable decor ;), treat your tastebuds and give it a try if you haven't already!
name: KRĒM
categories: Restaurants, Creperies, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Food

text:
Black Sesame ice cream was FREAKIN AMAZING! Came across this place while on vacation in Reno. So happy we did. The man and woman behind the counter were so nice and friendly. You are able to taste the flavors available that day before you choose your dessert. They had black Sesame, macha, ube, and vanilla. Don't get me wrong the ube and macha were good but the black Sesame was different and it was DELICIOUS. The best way to describe it was a smoothly almost coco chocolate taste. You can select the ice cream of your choice, cake (place on the bottom) a sauce of your choice like strawberries, chocolate, and condensed milk. 
Ugh...I've been crazy the ice cream, badly!
name: KRĒM
categories: Restaurants, Creperies, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Food

text: Love this place! I've come here a few times and every time is is awesome! The flavors are always delicious and very authentic to the original thing. Like the Ube reminds me of when I was younger and would get that flavor for a birthday cake... and the Thai tea legit tastes like the real deal. Matcha green tea is also delicious as well as the black sesame! If you grew up with these Asian flavors it'll make you feel nostalgic! Also the owner is so nice! Highly recommend!
name: KRĒM
categories: Restaurants, Creperies, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Food

text:
Review #141 - 2019

About a year ago, I came here & left disappointed because they were closed for 5 days while I was here around Thanksgiving time--which was understandable & forgivable.

Luckily, this time we showed up during summer since the kids had just finished school & I wanted to take them out to enjoy a few days of good eating.

We showed up around 6 PM on Monday, June 10th, and the place was actually pretty quiet.  I expected it to be a lot busier considering it was 93-degrees out, but I was fine with not having to fight the crowd.

The 3 kids got almost exactly the same thing, the matcha/vanilla, while my other nephew got the ube & I went with the ube/black sesame.

I really wanted to give this place a 5-star review since the people here are very friendly & accommodating.

The place is small, but clean and still felt comfortable with the table arrangements.  I love the cute set up, especially their Instagram wall.

The kids really enjoyed their dessert & I liked mine too, but I wish it was a little less sweet & a little creamier.  It didn't really taste like soft serve ice cream, more of a sorbet texture, which I wouldn't mind if it was more of a fruity flavor.

Portion seemed much bigger than I expected so I couldn't finish the whole thing, even with my daughter's help.

The kids had a nice time hanging out there playing Uno for about an hour.

We'll definitely be back in the future.
name: KRĒM
categories: Restaurants, Creperies, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Food

text:
If you are a lover of home made pot pies but want to skip the cooking, this is THE place.  It's taken a while to get here, as our pups' vet and groomers are located in this strip center, but this will certainly be in our regular rotation.

After checking out the reviews on Yelp! I scanned the pix for the menu, as the website doesn't list ingredients.  I placed the order online Monday for a Tuesday afternoon pickup (pups at the groomers).  Ordered the chicken and the beef/Guinness pot pie as well as a beef/mushroom and pork/yam empanada.  Super easy to do, just remember that the pies are usually made fresh and take about an hour...so keep that in mind...perfection takes time!!).  Without fail, the pups were done 2 hours early, so called to see if we could move the order up.  They said they had the chicken ready, but the beef/Guinness would take about an hour.  So they offered the Gumbo in exchange, which they had ready for inventory.  The empanadas only take about 8 minutes to make.  That worked great for us.

The place is set up for take out only, though there are picnic tables set up that are shared with another eatery.  You walk into the place and you are hit by the savory smells of fresh baking pies (they should make a candle in this scent!!).  Very helpful, friendly staff and had my order ready to go in minutes.  Had to ask how to reheat non-frozen pies (300 degrees for about 30 minutes, though a meat thermometer is highly suggested, as the pies are fully cooked and just need to be heated to serving temperature).  Smelled so good in the car they almost didn't make it home!

Unless your ravenous, the pies are easily sharable, as are the empanadas.  These are real pot pies, with flakey, buttery crust encasing the fillings.  We had the chicken pot pie along with the beef/mushroom empanada.  More than enough for the 2 of us for dinner.  After popping them in the oven for around 20 minutes, they were hot and ready.  The pot pie filling was absolutely delicious, complimented by the savory crust.  Filled with onions, carrots, celery, corn, peas and lots of chicken.  The beef/mushroom empanada is encased in a black sesame dough, filled with beef, mushrooms and peas in a dark savory gravy.  Again, perfect size for dinner...though I could have easily overeaten, it was soooo gooood!!!

We'll have the other pie and empanada for dinner tonight.  2 dinners for under $30 with the taste of homemade.  Yeah, we'll be back to try the other items.  

Highly recommend this place as a regular go-to.
name: emPIEnada
categories: Event Planning & Services, Restaurants, Empanadas, Caterers, Food, Desserts, Comfort Food, American (Traditional), Food Trucks

text:
I came around 7 pm on April 14th. The quality of the dessert here combined with the delicious exotic flavors make this place the most delicious ice cream I've had in ages! The soft serve is so creamy. I got black sesame flavor and it's sweet and mildly nutty and creamy, so good! The cake they use is so moist and buttery. (I got vanilla with condensed milk) I was very surprised and now obsessed. 

The guy working was so nice and helpful describing the flavors. He had a great attitude and so friendly! 10/10 service
name: KRĒM
categories: Restaurants, Creperies, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Food

text:
My favorite ice cream in town! Everyone who works here is extremely friendly and welcoming. My favorite flavor is black sesame so try it when you can! As far as COVID, they're taking all the precautions with face masks, gloves, blocked off seating etc. but special mention to the owner (I believe) for taking extra time to clean all the door knobs and chairs outside frequently. 
I appreciate you, Krēm please never leave me!
name: KRĒM
categories: Restaurants, Creperies, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Food

text: I ordered the chocolate wasted.  The soft serve was very good, the cake was a little dry but still tasty. The location is convenient and trendy inside with friendly staff.  I also tried the matcha and black sesame flavors. I enjoyed them but couldn't eat an entire serving.
name: KRĒM
categories: Restaurants, Creperies, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Food

text:
Went to Krēm today! I was SO excited to try it out after all the hype I saw on Instagram. Walking in, I was a bit disappointed because the ambience didn't add up to the one being boasted on insta. THE ICECREAM IS TO DIE FOR! So delicious. It's a generous portion as well. Super pleased with it overall and can't wait to go back! 
PS: I recommend the black sesame
name: KRĒM
categories: Restaurants, Creperies, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Food

text: I came here on a Tuesday night and it was really crazy. The organization of this place was pretty messy. The register is located at the back of the store, which is pretty confusing. You have to pay for your order, then wait for them to call your name, instead of waiting in a line. The staff has to go around shouting your name and searching around the store for you in order to start making your ice cream, which is pretty inefficient. We waited over 30 minutes before being called...I do appreciate the unique Asian flavors this place offers such as Thai tea, taro, and black sesame. The decor and music was nice. It's not the best ambiance to hang out in as it is super loud from all the chopping. The place cod just use more structure and organization. They also have two boards with the ice cream flavors, but nothing displaying the toppings, so it took everyone a lot of time asking the staff every time. The ice cream is on the pricey side, $8. It was tasty, but a bit unnecessary chopping. I've been to several rolling ice cream places where they smash the toppings into the ice cream, but instead this place just adds it on top. Lastly, the spoons were not durable at all. It kept bending every time you would try and scoop up your ice cream. Although I appreciate the twist on flavors, the chaos and disorganization made the experience underwhelming.
name: Choppa Ice Cream
categories: Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt, Food

text:
A little expensive but the ice cream is pretty good! I got the black sesame (dark matter) and added some strawberries.

Great location and atmosphere though

Would recommend, the flavors are unique and not your typical vanilla or chocolate etc
name: Choppa Ice Cream
categories: Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt, Food

text:
I've had my eye on this cute, trendy cafe for a while, so yesterday, after a long, hot day at work, I decided to stop by and give myself a treat. The cafe was clean and modern, with excellent decor, tantalizing pictures of food, and bright colors abound. I ordered a sesame egg waffle (only $2.75!), grabbed a table, and watched the young server behind the counter make the waffle right in front of me. 

She looked bored and angsty, so I smiled and commented on her demeanor. After a couple of exchanges, she asked if I knew Chinese. Yes, both Mandarin and Cantonese! Turns out her sour service earlier was simply due to a long day and inhibited conversation with English-speaking folks. She transformed from a sour waitress to a bubbly expressive one once the language barrier was removed! (So, 4 stars for service.)
 
The sesame waffle was handed over to me wrapped in wax paper in a brown paper bag. It smelled amazing. I didn't know how to eat it so I ripped off the bulbs in the waffle one by one. (Whereas normal square waffles have pockets, these have the opposite -- they bulge out.) The inside was fluffy, soft, and sweet, and infused with black sesame. It was heaven.

Look on the walls across from the counter for three delightful paintings of Chinese cooks in the act of preparing pizza, noodles, and stir-fried vegetables. I don't see art featuring Asian-Americans much, so I asked to take pictures of them to save.

Took a menu with me to go. Everything was translated into perfect English. I can't wait to be back to try the green tea waffle, shaved ice, and the kimchi rice. If you are looking for a drink, go across the street to Bread Top House --- much cheaper there, but of excellent quality (fresh fruit!!!)
name: Cube Cafe

text:
I said it before and I will say it again.  Take whatever trend is happening in LA and 5 years later it will make its way to Santa Barbara.  We finally have a Thai ice cream place here and the business was booming.  Its a little like coldstone creamery.  They mix a cup of ice cream base and your choice of flavor on a super cold piece of metal, flatten it out, and chisel/push it off the surface with a metal spatula so it looks like giant chocolate shavings.  They have some unique Asian flavors that you don't see in McConnells or Ben and Jerry's such as Thai tea, taro, and black sesame.  

I got the Thai tea, which needed to be stronger in tea flavor.  Kids got the oreo and cream (good and basic) and banana and nutella (very fresh banana flavor).  Each ice cream came with 3 free toppings.  I liked the chewy mini mochi, pocky sticks, and the fresh fruit toppings.  There were also chocolate chips, m&m, sprinkles, oreo, gummy bears, etc.  

There were quite a few stations to make the rolled ice cream, but despite the numbers of employees, the wait was still very long because each order was made to order.  I can think of three small changes to make the ordering process less chaotic.  First, have a sign direct patrons to the cashier or place the cashier right by the front entrance.  Second, turn down the party music by a notch or two.  I wasn't the only one who couldn't hear my name being called.  Third, instead of copy off Starbucks and call customers by name, just assign a number instead.  This will give people a better sense of where they are in line so they don't have to pester the cashier and ask if their name had been called.
name: Choppa Ice Cream
categories: Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt, Food

text: This is the most unique and entertaining way to eat ice cream. When I first walked in and was amazed by all the toppings they had. I tried several favors in the passed week and I really love black sesame. The owner was super nice and explained everything in details. I would come back every day if I can. Super delicious
name: Choppa Ice Cream
categories: Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt, Food

text:
Phenomenal.  

Really - I have nothing bad to say about Copia.  I went for a work lunch and was pretty excited since I'd hard good things about it and never went before the fire destroyed it a while back.  We walked in and my eyes grew to the size of saucers - the bar/ restaurant is beautiful!  From the glass waterfall separating the bar area from the rest of the restaurant to the beautiful tiling used throughout to the gorgeous light fixtures, I almost forgot I was there to eat.  (Blame my having an Interior Design degree.)

We were then led out back to the stunning wine garden.  It was like being transported to a relaxing, tropical resort given the retractable roof, soothing fountain in the middle of the patio, and being surrounded by palm trees and Hibiscus plants!   So relaxing.

Our server was extremely nice and helpful with tips about what was good to eat there.  And lucky us - the Executive Chef Dave Rook was there that day and had just whipped up a new lunch special - beef tenderloin on baked ciabatta bread with cheese and veggies and some sort of delicious sauce on top.  And apparently when the chef whips up a special, it's best to try it as you won't be disappointed.  My two co-workers both had it and were very happy with their choice!

I had the Goat Cheese Salad - BEST. SALAD. EVER.  Mixed greens, roasted chicken, sweet onions, sliced strawberries tossed in a cracked pepper berry vinaigrette and topped with a ball of warm 
sesame-encrusted goat cheese.  Oh, heaven in a bowl.  I about licked my plate clean, it was that good - and it was under $9!  You can't beat that.

Copia seems to have a great variety of lunch and dinner items, all which have interesting food combinations.  I can't wait to go back and try the Flash Fried Calamari, Spicy Mango Chicken Pizza, Grilled Chicken Lasagna, or Black Sesame Seared Ahi.  And I can't ignore their abundant wine selection, either.  

Copia's website states that "Copia is the Roman goddess of abundance, wealth, pleasure, and harvest."  I agree - Copia was definitely a pleasure to visit and I plan on going back many, many times.
name: Copia Restaurant & Wine Garden

text:
The rolled ice cream hype has finally made it to Nashville! Just for that alone, you should make a visit. The shop is fairly small and has only 3 windows for making ice cream so expect a decent wait (20-25 mins) when there's a small line. The flavor options are good and you can choose a base flavor, pick a add in to mix with your base, and then choose 2 toppings. I ended up ordering a red bean ice base (they were out of green tea and black sesame), mixed it with banana, and then added coconut shreds and a wafer stick to top it off. Overall, pretty good flavor; however, I have to say I prefer Jeni's for the quality and variety of flavors they offer (goat cheese and cherry and the expresso will always be my jams). Price is fairly steep at around $7 a cup. 

The novelty alone made it worth the wait. Plus, it's very insta-worthy. 

#getyarollon
name: Supreme Kreme
categories: Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt, Desserts, Bubble Tea, Food

text: Amazing mochi!! Particularly loved the passionfruit, green tea and black sesame. Hand rolled ice cream is pretty good but thought the flavor options were just okay - would like a bit more filling added which would lend to better flavor. Had the coffee and fererr rocher and the flavors were both very subtle. Would like to try one of the Nutella flavors next time.
name: Seventh Heaven
categories: Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt, Thai, Vegan, Desserts, Japanese, Food, Restaurants

text:
I LOVE THIS PLACE. There are so many flavors to choose from. They even let you choose 3 toppings at the end, while other ice cream places usually charge you extra for toppings.

My favorites are the matcha-cha (matcha green tea) and dark matter (black sesame)! So good. They're literally rolled with love. I can't wait to try out the other flavors!
name: Choppa Ice Cream
categories: Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt, Food

text: $8 minimum on credit card. Staff were attentive and knowledgable. Very trendy cafe with good lighting and ambiance. Overall, the baked goods were not that impressive. Mini-muffins were dry and noticeably bland. Interesting mix of tofu smoothies and straight soy milk. Specialty soy milk is eclectic. Had a black sesame soy. Freshly made soy milk is very different than what you get in the grocery store and super tasty. Will probably give this place another shot some time and try their hot breakfast foods.
name: Soy Cafe

text:
A nice, cozy cafe with quality vegan/vegetarian options at more accessible prices! 

I particularly enjoyed the black sesame soy drink--it reminded me of the black sesame soft serve that I like to get in Japan. It wasn't too sweet, and the soy milk that was used didn't have a pungent aftertaste and was deliciously silky. The black sesame was a very delicious complement to the elegantly delicate soy milk, and the drink had a very pleasant nutty flavor. If I were to mention something that could be improved, it would be that when the drink was served, it wasn't as steaming hot as I would have liked it to be. 

The hummus is creamy, and the vegetable sticks are crisp, fresh, and delicious. It is so refreshing to have simple food done well at reasonable prices. I wish this place existed where I live!
name: Soy Cafe

text:
ROLLED ICE CREAM IN SB!! YAAAAS!!!

Pretty good stuff. They're new and we went during a rush ): waited 40 minutes for our ice cream, but ITS REALLY GOOD AND WE WERENT IN A RUSH SO ITS FINE!! They had all the stations going and the place was packed. I feel bad for their arms man i would be so tired choppin it up like that nonstop.

We got the strawberry graham one. It's called "for the 'gram" DAAAAANK!! You can taste the real strawberry pieces in it. We got ours with strawberry pocky, strawberry hello panda, and fresh strawberries.. talk about strawberry overload huehue. OH AND WHIPPED CREAM DUHHH.

There's many flavors to choose from and toppings on rotation!! You can choose up to 3 toppings, and whipped cream and a sauce on top. Next time I'm looking to try their matcha, black sesame, or thai tea flavored rolls. IM HAPPY THIS PLACE EXISTS!!

10/10 would recommend
name: Choppa Ice Cream
categories: Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt, Food

text:
I'm probably missing something here... chopped and rolled ice cream? It seems to me I was paying for the novelty of the experience of this type of ice cream. This would be fine with the understanding that the end product's flavor and texture measured with the delay in gratification met the novelty. 

Thirty five (35) minutes from paying to receiving said product. Only four (4) numbers between me and my turn once paid for. This seems a little long to be waiting on a cool, slow night for ice cream. I knew ahead of time that there would be a wait; still was disappointed. I couldn't imagine the wait on a hot summer night. 

As for the product, mine bland (black sesame); wife's flavorful (oreo & cream). Texture wasn't that of ice cream or gelato or popsicle but rather shaved ice. 

Volume of said ice cream in container is about a scoop (small). Overall, interesting to watch the production but not very satisfying in the end.
name: Choppa Ice Cream
categories: Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt, Food

text:
After going to the Ice district location and liking it, I figured I would give this location a try. Came in on a Thursday evening and this place was so disorganized. With 1 person on food prep, 1 person on drinks and 2 waitresses, it was a complete downhill experience from here. Luckily we got our order taken quite promptly, but we watched others who were not so lucky walk out of this place after being left unattended for 10-15mins. 

We ended up ordering the American style hot chocolate after being told the black sesame hot cocoa was discontinued. We also opted for the double triple chocolate fondue. We waited around 20 mins for our fondue to arrive and boy oh boy.. The waffle was undercooked and cold in the middle and tasted like raw dough. We ended up telling one of the waitress and she completely panicked, apologized and said that they were receiving similar complaints the whole night. (Interestingly enough, the table next to us also complained about the undercooked waffle before us as we were being seated). We were approached by another waitress, who said they would be replacing the waffle and giving us a discount for the inconvenience. We ended up getting a replacement waffle with the same results. By then, we gave up and just ate the fruits and left the waffles as is. 

The interior is really cute and it's such a shame this location is so disorganized and understaffed. I wish the desserts at this place was better. To be honest, I wouldn't pay $20 on fondue to eat cut fruits and undercooked waffles. We ended up getting a 15% discount for the fondue which wasn't worth it. I felt bad for the one staff who was running around making all the food by himself and the other waitresses trying to keep up with all the tables. Hoping management will be able to save this place by hiring more staff to help out.
name: Cacao 70 Eatery
categories: Cafes, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Food, Specialty Food, Chocolatiers & Shops, Desserts

text:
Took a few out-of-town business associates to Copia restaurant last Wednesday night, and was quite pleased with the restaurant, food and setting.    We started with a glass of Stag's Leap Cabernet savignon at the bar, until our group of 4 was fully assembled and then told the hostess we were ready to be seated for dinner.  She seated us in their outdoor, covered wine garden which was quite nice, the ambiance of being outdoors but without the street-noise and bustle of many outdoor venues.

We began our meal with a couple of starters, a stuffed portabello mushroom and some flash-fried calamari, both very good.  Specials that night included a bone-in fillet Mignon and a pretty massive 16 oz. beef fillet.  Three of our guest chose the fillet, while I chose the Black sesame Ahi tuna (our server's recommendation), and it did not disappoint.  A bottle or two of the Stag's Leap Cabernet accompanied our dinners and I think everyone had a very satisfying meal.

Was all-in-all quite satisfied with the experience at Copia.  As other reviewers have commented, I was only surprised by the lack of crowd at the restaurant this evening.  Not sure if was due to the lack of the ball team not being in town, or the fact that there are now a number of good choices up-and-down Washington Avenue.  No matter, for I will definitely return to Copia for both business as well as personal/family occasions in the future.
name: Copia Restaurant & Wine Garden

text:
I've been meaning to check this place out for a while. It's awesome to have a place with this type of ice cream after seeing videos of street vendors making ice cream "rolls"! 

I love that they have more Asian flavors like black sesame, taro, matcha, etc. I tried the black sesame which was a great mild flavor, not too strong. For most flavors, you can't mix/match. The mix/match flavors come premixed. 

When I went the facility was a little dirty but they were actively cleaning. The decor is cute!

The prices are pretty high for some ice cream - a little under $7 for one size. The ice cream came out with really hard crusted texture, but not sure if that was because I got black sesame. Overall if I have another craving I'll come back!
name: Choppa Ice Cream
categories: Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt, Food

text:
it's cool to have an ice cream place nearby that has asian-inspired flavors - from matcha to Thai tea to black sesame! I tried it and I like how thick and creamy the ice cream is. 

Still extremely busy - with a 30 mins to 1 hr wait, but I think it's because goleta doesn't have really trendy places that are instagrammable and what not, this place fills that void. 
Everything is made to order so it's not the traditional scoop and enjoy, thus it takes about 3-5 mins to make each one. 

There are lots of people taking pictures of the decor and the pretty wing wall! 

It's pricey, but only about 50 cents more (before tax) than the places in LA/SD that I've tried/seen.
 
Can't wait for them to expand with more topping options!
name: Choppa Ice Cream
categories: Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt, Food

text:
More Sugar is a cute new addition to Chinatown, tucked away on the corner of 11th and Cherry.  Although their sign says "Brunch & Dessert", they also offer a full dinner menu, which is what my friend and I had. 

For our entrees, we ordered the rack of lamb and seared tuna bowl (spoiler: it comes on a plate lol). The lamb was decently tender and flavorful, but the star of the night was the tuna bowl -- I could eat plain rice with their house special sauce and die in peace. 

For dessert, we ordered the sesame creme brulee and tiramisu. I absolutley loved the nutty addition of black sesame to the creme brulee, but it had an unexpectedly thick consistency. The tiramisu also fell a little flat with the thick layer of cocoa powder leaving us in caughing fits. 

Overall, I'd describe More Sugar as the new kid on the block, still figuring its identity. It currently offers a little bit of everything to please everyone, but if they narrowed their focus, perfected their craft, and just ran with it, I believe they could easily become a community favorite. 

I will definitely be back to try their brunch (so rare in Chinatown!) and can't wait to see how this promising little business develops.
name: More Sugar

text:
Ah, Froyo. I love frozen yoghurt and I love options. Sometimes, too much is a bad thing, but that's why I love how you can put as much as you want! I've been to my fair share of froyo places, but they tend to have more Asian flavors like taro or black sesame. Here? They have imaginative AMERICAN flavors like Orange Dreamsicle and Blueberry Pecan Pie. Same concept of unlimited toppings, though, and they're pretty similar as well, though they have other items like cereal and granola as well.

I actually struggled a bit when I came in. The staff were busy taking care of orders so I stood by the menu and alternated between studying that and staring at the extensive toppings bar. Then I got distracted by something else. I finally realised that the actual yogurt was behind me. I knew the staff saw me, but I guess they thought I knew how it worked. Would have been nice if they asked me if it was my first time or needed help. I mean, someone can't be so indecisive to stare at the menu and then toppings for 3 minutes, right?

First, I wanted a smoothie, but I already had a smoothie that morning. I was curious about the Froyo Float and was amused by the Beer Float. I saw the crepes (very reasonably priced at around $4 each), but I wanted something cool... though I was tempted by those as well. I can't say anything about the size, but if I came again, I'd probably try one with a smoothie. I ended up going for a custom froyo. 

Something new that they offer are these little dividers to prevent your yoghurt flavors from combining. I added one just for fun, even though they don't really work for me. I love all sorts of flavors and I love trying new things, so I usually have around 4 flavors or so. I added two flavors in each of the two compartments and threw some toppings on top. Their froyo tastes like most of the froyo places I've been to. The flavors were unique to them and mostly distinct. It was good - can't really complain. If I lived in the area, I'd definitely come by if I needed a froyo fix.

Hubby got his iced coffee - cold brew. He's curious about that. He thought it tasted fine... I think he still prefers his coffee hot and black. I tasted it as well since I prefer cold drinks. It tasted a little different. I'm not a coffee connoisseur by any means though I used to drink it a lot (Hubby drinks more than enough for the two of us now), I thought it tasted a little different. Smoother? Different undertone? Either way, it wasn't a bad thing. It also seems like they use Intelligentsia coffee. I'm not familiar with this brand, but I heard of it a lot when I started research of coffee places to visit while visiting the Midwest.

All in all, I love their choices. After you order, they bring it to you (unless you designed your own froyo treat). The place was pretty large and clean with a good amount of customers coming in and out. It would have been nice if they were less passive with their service, though. Despite that, they were pretty nice when they did help.
name: Pearings Cafe + Frozen Yogurt
categories: Food, Specialty Food, Juice Bars & Smoothies, Internet Cafes, Coffee & Tea, Fruits & Veggies, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt, Do-It-Yourself Food

text:
Very attentive, polite, nice and just so many words to their employees. Their food was phenomenal it was sooooo good the bread were fresh and the meat was also   Nicely seasoned and their chicken were sooooo crispy and great. I for sure gonna go back there. Just a little btw they add black sesame to their bread which not everyone does making it more special than most place. 
The only thing I think you should avoid is the cheese fries it's a bit over priced for some cheese on the top but that would not change the fact their fries are crispy and salted nicely and also won't change the fact I'm giving this place an direct 5

text:
Michelle and the whole crew at Twelve Baskets Cupcakes provided my family and I with a very unique, delicious alternative to your typical dessert. I threw a party for my mother-in-law and had 2 dozen cupcakes delivered. It truly was a show-stopper as people were interested in trying something different: Asian Fusion delicacies. They were an absolute hit at the party as young and old alike were clamoring to try as many flavors as possible. 
The Azukies 'n Cream was truly original. The cake was soft and fluffy and the frosting was succulent. The Miso Caramel Apple was amazing too as was the Red Velvet. But the winner by far (for me) was the Peanut Butter Crumble- perfect balance of sweet, nutty flavor and crunchiness. Just delish! 
We really couldn't go wrong with any of the choices and I will be ordering again ASAP as there a few flavors I want to try. Like the Black Sesame Honey. Or the Lemongrass Blues... You get the idea!
name: Twelve Baskets
categories: Cupcakes, Bakeries, Desserts, Food

text: This place has some nice pastries but is  bit overpriced compared to what I'm used to paying in Chinatown. It is a chain and I believe they don't make their products from scratch, but rather "bake them off" That said everything I tried was fresh. I like the toasts, but my favorite is the black sesame/pumpkin donut and some kind of french croissant-like pastry w/chocolate. Buns are so-so and like I said you can do a lot better in Chinatown for about half the price. Items at PB tend to range from $1.40- $2.00.
name: Paris Baguette
categories: Coffee & Tea, Bakeries, Desserts, Food, Patisserie/Cake Shop

text: This spot is amazing for brunch (and it's served all day). They have several gluten free options. We ordered the Banana Chip (which was two HUGE pancakes bigger than my face - the black sesame cream that comes with it takes it to another level), the Fried Pickeled Okra, and the Shrimp & Grits. All gluten free, all absolutely delicious. I'm definitely coming back next time I'm in town.
name: Bearcat Cafe

text:
Wow, I'm in love with these cupcakes! I'm not even a big sweets person and maybe that's why I like them so much (b/c they're not that sweet), but I would have these for desserts all the time! I haven't placed an order with them before, but I just had a tasting of their mini cupcakes tonight at the Yelp's 10th Anniversary Bash -- O M G! You can bet your ass off I'll be making an order at some point in the near future. I won't even need the to deliver, so hopefully pick-up is an option. 

The available selections were: black sesame honey, takes two to taro, miso salted caramel, and azukies' n cream. The GF and I liked them all, but I personally liked the miso, taro, azukies, and then black sesame. I'm already spreading the word to friends that it's the best I've had! Maybe because they're Asian inspired and they hit home for me, but I would definitely recommend them to the adventurous people out there to try.
name: Twelve Baskets
categories: Cupcakes, Bakeries, Desserts, Food

text:
Hands down my favorite spot in the city to grab local chocolates. Almost all the chocolate is made in house, and you can even see some of the process in the back, by the café. They grow their own herbs and farm their own honey in the building as well. The staff is knows their stuff and is always incredibly friendly - they can tell you the differences in their chocolate and how it's made in so much detail, it's amazing. 

Personal favorites include: Black Sesame meltaway, Pistachio meltaway, Earl Grey caramel, Honey Lavender caramel, Mexican Hot Chocolate truffle, Royal Spanish drinking chocolate and their Ecuador single origin chocolate bar.

They also do confectionary history tours, if you're into that.
name: Shane Confectionery
categories: Coffee & Tea, Specialty Food, Desserts, Candy Stores, Food, Local Flavor, Chocolatiers & Shops

text:
PROS: Unique cupcake flavors, not too sweet
CONS: They're not in Philly :(

I was never much of a cupcake person... because most cupcakes out there are just too cloyingly sweet and lacking in flavor complexity to me. However, these cupcakes from Twelve Baskets I do like (very much, in fact). They have interesting Asian-inspired cupcakes, such as matcha, black sesame, azuki, and taro, and they don't taste like pure thickened sugar. In addition to being yummy, the cupcakes are cute-looking (always a plus). Overall, I would hit up their shop every week if it weren't for the fact that they are quite far from me.
name: Twelve Baskets
categories: Cupcakes, Bakeries, Desserts, Food

text: Wonderful bon bons, awesome Mexican hot chocolate and salvadoreño cheese cake with black sesame. Must visit when in Tucson

text: Such an adorable and endearing place - with great Asian-inspired flavor options: matcha tiramisu, black sesame, as well as other classic flavors like sea salt caramel for their shakes! Their cloud shakes are TALL too, and so cute! Come by and get yourself a delicious summer treat!
name: Aqua S
categories: Desserts, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt, Food

text: If you love soft serve ice cream, this is the place to go! I managed to get some mini tubs during this pandemic and it definitely fulfilled every sweet dream I've been having. My favorites were the matcha and lychee (dairy free). The lychee was more of a sorbet type of texture, but both were more on the semi-sweet side. The black sesame was alright in my opinion, while the Thai tea was quite milky but good. Definitely would be coming back to try more of their flavors!
name: Aqua S
categories: Desserts, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt, Food

text:
So fresh and so clean (like the OutKast song). Isn't that what you want out of a place that handles raw fish?

I came in here for ice cream, believe it or not. There's only two places in the world I've ever had Black Sesame, this place and a gelato shop near the river in Florence, Italy. But this place uses the rolling technique you've probably seen in videos of Southeast Asia. 

So the ice cream was insanely good. My fiance chose nutella with fresh bananas (I ended up finishing hers too). 

As I walked out the store, I told the owner (who is super nice and patient) that I would be back for poke. 

Well here I am. Day 2 eating salmon poke with sushi rice and veggies and a sauce he makes personally.  There's a lot of places to eat in SB, but this has quickly become one of my favorites.
name: Choppa Poke

text:
I come here consistently to treat myself with a misugaru latte. I find myself craving it quite often and the multigrain flavor is nutty (while still being sweet) with a strong black sesame flavor. I would highly recommend trying it! They claim it has health benefits but even if it wasn't true I would still get it because it's so good.

The thickness of the latte has not been consistent (it was very watery once) and the wifi is spotty sometimes, but otherwise, it's a nice, quaint, Asian-themed cafe with plenty of food and drink options.
name: Caffe Bene
categories: Coffee & Tea, Food

text: We stop by here for ice cream after we went took our kids to the aquarium! So glad they have a location in NOLA no need to go far to Houston anymore ! We brought the butter toffee with sea salt and hot chocolate so Yumm !! Our kids both enjoyed ! We also brought 8 small container of ice cream to go ! 3Durian, matcha,Thai tea, black sesame,strawberry and pineapple. Cute little dessert place plus the staff was very friendly! We totally come back when come to NOLA!
name: Aqua S
categories: Desserts, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt, Food

text:
They had a table set up at yelp's 10th anniversary. I tried the black sesame with (i assume) condensed milk icing. I love asian flavors and the mini cupcake was amazing. super moist and the cake itself wasn't sweet but the icing had the right amount of sweetness to the whole "two bite" size cupcake. 

Tried the chocolate one too, although i'm not a big chocolate eater, i thought it was good too, just not on the same level as the black sesame. Will definitely pick up some when i'm in the area or when/if they set up at other places.
name: Twelve Baskets
categories: Cupcakes, Bakeries, Desserts, Food

text:
The place is clean with a simple design. Workers are friendly and welcoming, offering us multiple samples of different ice cream flavors. The matcha was lightly sweetened and had perfect flavoring. I ended up going with the Vietnamese coffee in a donut which they warmed up!!!! My husband got the bubble waffle with salted caramel which came with his topping of choice, whipped cream and a pocky stock. The waffle wasn't too sweet and slightly crunchy which complimented the ice cream well. I wish it had a little bit more of a buttery taste like the ones from Hong Kong but seriously I'm not going to hold that against this place. I do hope that in the future that they will have more flavors with the waffles, maybe pandan, charcoal or even black sesame. It would also be nice to have other toppings like red bean or li hing mui powder. 

They also offer cookies and macaroons which we did not try but maybe next time :)
name: Sweet Handkraft
categories: Desserts, Specialty Food, Food, Macarons, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt

text: I am usually unimpressed by wraps, but Sweet Art's Botanical wrap is the best I've ever had and a guaranteed mood booster. It's a hefty portion, packed with tofu (baked, I believe), veggies, and a peanut-curry sauce with black sesame seeds. Came with a little kiwi fruit on the side too. For dessert I treated myself to the vegan brownie. I'm not a vegan, and my prior experiences with vegan baked goods have been unpleasant. But this was one of the most decadent and delicious brownies I've ever had. I don't know how they do it! Free wifi and perfect atmosphere are two more pluses. I just wish they were open on Sundays.
name: SweetArt

text:
I have a confession: I don't understand the mochi doughnut craze. And I tried the ones at Sweet Handkraft which are supposed to be amazing!!! Don't get me wrong, they're good and taste less artificial than other doughnuts, but it's still a doughnut. And even though I tried, I just can't get super excited about them. 

That said, Sweet Handkraft does have relatively good doughnuts. We got a dozen and tried all the different flavors. They're doughnuts are easy to rip apart and almost designed for sharing, score! The Black Sesame one is solid. My favorite was the Lychee Rose flavor though. Such great rose flavoring!! A little on the sweet side, but perfect as an afternoon dessert. Cookies & Cream is good and if you like a strong coffee flavor, they've got you covered.

Good mochi doughnuts here, but still just doughnuts. So if I have to pick my sugar vice, I'm going back to something frozen. But should I find myself craving a doughnut, no doubt I'm coming back for Lychee Rose.
name: Sweet Handkraft
categories: Desserts, Specialty Food, Food, Macarons, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt

text:
I'm not sure I really understand this place as a brick and mortar spot (though I never met it as a truck either).  Walked by with a friend on our way to dinner and we decided to pop in - it's a fun looking space and the door said 'puddin' was inside there.  After trying two of the puddings, black sesame and salted caramel we decided to buy a salted caramel and a...carrot cake maybe? (Not slamming the flavor, just don't remember since it was for delivering to an at home friend).  We were also talked into trying a couple macarons - we chose earl grey chocolate and taro.

The good: it's a cute space, it's creative, the help was nice, you can taste some of the puddings, it's not like anything else in Chinatown.

The not good:  If you're a pudding bakery, in addition to creative choices (pumpkin spice banana) it might be good to sell some classics and do them really well.  Chocolate?  Vanilla? The salted caramel was nice, but not make-that-trip-again nice.  The black sesame that we tried had an uncomfortable firm mousse-like texture and tasted like weak peanut butter, but not sesame.  Again, if you only sell four puddings, and it's part of your identity, you need to nail it.  The macarons were an example of this as well.  As some other reviewers have said, they were kind of soggy and kind of bland.  The earl grey chocolate did taste like those flavors but the cookie was really too chewy.  The taro had a better crunch to chew ratio but tasted like sugar flavor only.

Also, for two puddings and two macarons we were in for $14.  Some of the best restaurants in the city serve desserts at around $8-12 per person and they are amazing.    Nothing that we experienced of Audabon was flat out terrible, but it kind of felt like the desserts were something that I might be happy to eat homemade, at a friends house, but not for spending my treat money.  

I'm not sure how long they have been there, so maybe they are just working out the kinks.  I hope so, I like the idea very much it's just the execution that left me hanging.
name: Audabon Bakeshop
categories: Desserts, Bakeries, Food, Caterers, Event Planning & Services

text: I am a huge macaron fan and their flavors attract me so much such as the Matcha Green Tea or the Black Sesame, even though they have flavors that cannot be found everywhere I would not say that they have the best macaron in Philly, but most unique. The macarons are a bit sweet for my taste and I do wish that each flavors should be stronger. The Matcha Green Tea Mousse is amazing though and all the new creations they have it is a place worth a try
name: Audabon Bakeshop
categories: Desserts, Bakeries, Food, Caterers, Event Planning & Services

text:
Being the only restaurant of its kind in Edmonton, there really isn't a way to compare it to others. This Chinese dessert house made its way to Edmonton after starting off in Calgary's chinatown. I have heard the prices are comparable to the original location, but it's quite expensive considering the price for 1 bowl is enough to buy ingredients for a whole pot! Of course, we wouldn't be here if everyone could make their own.

There is a ton of items listed, but not available, on their menu. My guess is they either had the food chef leave after opening or they listed it planning for future growth. That or they simply copied Calgary's version of the menu and crossed off everything they weren't offering. Either way, please stop being stingy and reprint your menus. It's been nearly half a year and your second location, so I think you can spare some change and not frustrate the hell out of your customers. It's a problem when half (LITERALLY half!) the menu is crossed off.

Anyways, we are here to talk about the food. It's not worth the price they charge but, I have got to say, the desserts are delicious and made authentically from raw ingredients. The almond drinks/desserts aren't smooth, but it proves they use real almonds versus artificial flavouring. Their tofu fa (or bean curd as they call it) was typical, but they give you the option of adding red bean or black sesame paste to it. I ordered red bean, but their black sesame paste was so amazingly delicious that I regret not being a little more adventurous. Again, their sesame paste was not smooth because it was made from grinding up real sesame seeds! If you order any of their steam egg items, be prepared to wait around 20 minutes as they make it from scratch and steam to ensure freshness. They also have rose tea, bubble tea, and taiwanese drinks available. These are drinks are borderline averagely priced to expensive. One thing to note about the drinks: If you take out, the containers are free. But if you stayed and ordered it with take out containers, they will charge you. No option of staying partly and leaving with a drink? Haha...I'm a little confused over that myself.

Their service was alright. Nothing to rave about or complain about. They did their job, but nothing exceptional.

This place would deeply hurt my wallet if I made this a regular experience, but for group hangouts, this isn't too bad. Oh, as a side note, this place can only accommodate for about 20 people at a time. With how long the food takes to get to you and limited seating, it may take a while for you to get a table/food. Hope you have good company! For those of you like me who have wonderful Chinese mothers who can do it all, I will be ordering these desserts from home. For those who don't, this is a piece of heaven away from home with a slightly higher price tag.
name: The Dessert House
categories: Desserts, Food

text:
WE ALL SCREAM FOR ICE CREAM!!! had to try a dip ice cream... there are many flavours you could dip your ice cream in! i tried the coffee and it is pretty good! the dip coffee with some coffee grinds! it is a bit sweet and thick but still good! the other flavour is black sesame, it also is delish! will come again to try other flavour.

Only issue is parking :(
name: Cacao 70 Sweet House
