text:
I went to the soft opening about a week or so ago. I got the Black Sesame and GreenTea mix and I thought it was very good! It wasn't too sweet or flavorless. 

Because it was a soft opening, I got a discount; I believe 20 or 25% off. I wouldn't get it for the full price. The ice cream wasn't THAT good. 

To be honest, I only went because of their black ice cream cones. It's the first place I've found in Philadelphia that had black cones! Great for pictures and the 'gram! 

The store itself was spacious. When I went, there were almost no decorations. All the furniture is white. I didn't like how they positioned their tables; they were so close together that it was hard to move without asking the other people sitting at other tables to move their chairs. 

Also, they seemed a bit unprepared. They didn't have change for my friend who was trying to pay with a $20 (but they ended up just giving it to her for free).

4/5!
name: Kuriimii
categories: Food, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt

text:
I don't really believe in $6/$7 for soft serve ice-cream, even if it has Asian-inspired flavors (which happen to be my favorite type of flavors). Perhaps it was only my personal experience there but both the taste and service wasn't up to par with the price. And yeah, they say "limitless toppings", but it feels just a bit misleading in that they only put a minimum amount of each type of topping and the toppings available are very inconsistent (i.e. no teddy bears even when it was advertised on the board). 

I had the taro and the black sesame when I visited, and the taro was okay but nothing to rave about. Black sesame was actually rather unpalatable, with an oddly spicy and bitter flavor. I wasn't the only person who thought so; 4 out of the 5 people who were there didn't even want a second bite of the black sesame. To be fair, some of them had tried the black sesame flavor there before and said that it had tasted different/better previously. I generally like black sesame flavors, but perhaps they wanted it to be stronger given previous reviews and it happened to backfire. 

Sure, sometimes it's nice to shell out for dessert, but there are many other options that are far more worthwhile within a few block radius. Plus, soft serve is not a new concept - swing by Micky Ds anytime for the same type of deliciousness for just a happy $1.
name: Kuriimii
categories: Food, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt

text:
This was my first time at Winterfell Dessert. I'm a huge Game of Thrones fan so I was a little sad that the room didn't live up to the name (though the house word/ice puns were pretty good!). The decor reminds me of places in China, with the addition of some comic book vinyl figures and board games. 

They have many flavors and toppings to choose from, as well as their pre-created specials menu. I shared the JS (black sesame ice, mochi, white sprinkles, vanilla cookies and cream, condensed milk) because I wanted to try sesame as a sweet flavor (as opposed to the usual savory). The cup looks huge when it first comes out, but the ice is super fluffy. I wasn't entirely wowed by my selection when I tried it - the combination of the type of ice and toppings didn't really fit with what I wanted in a dessert at that moment. It has the potential to be really good though, and I think I'll create my own next time.
name: Winterfell Dessert

categories: Food, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt

text:
I'm torn here between 3 and 4 stars.  

Atmosphere - I loved the furniture, which was made by someone locally (Fernley maybe?) from reclaimed woods, and we sat at a long, hightop, that could have sat maybe 8 or 10?

We stopped in on Friday night, for their tapas menu.  Here's what we ordered:

Crispy friend monkfish, soy sake broth, wasabi creme - $11

Pernod Steamed PEI mussles, grape tomatoes, jalapeno bacon - $13

Smoke pork enchiladas, machego and oaxaca - $9

Russian ghost cone, espresso ice cream, and chocolate souffle - $11

I really liked the monkfish, and though the presentation was great, with julienne veggies and seaweed for accents, black sesame atop the wasabi creme, etc.  Flavors blended well too.

The mussels were fine - no wow factor here, but just solid mussels.

Enchiladas were a bit of a miss - they were closer to lukewarm than warm, and were just kind of there.

The dessert was great - delicous souffle, and the ghost cone was this thin, gelatinous film, that complimented the espresso ice cream well.  The ice cream was maybe a bit too smooth, but overall a good dessert.

The reason I'm torn is mainly since I expected a tapas menu to be a bit more affordable.  The price point was definitely higher than expected.  Menu was rad and innovative, but considering that 2 of the 4 items we had were a bit of a miss, I don't think the GF and I had a $45 meal.  For now, I'm going to stick with 3 stars, as they didn't wow me, but there's definitely potential there.
name: Composition Cafe

text: Pretty good soft serve. The top flavors for me were matcha, taro, and charcoal vanilla. They didn't have black sesame when we visited. They let you sample before you chose which helps in making a choice. They also have WiFi!
name: Kuriimii
categories: Food, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt

text: Yay for a soft serve place in Philly! My ice cream prayers have finally been answered! If you frequent NYC, this place is comparable to Soft Swerve. I assume they're going for a similar vibe. The flavors lean towards pleasing the Asian palette (being based in Chinatown, that's pretty appropriate), so you'll see flavors like Matcha, Taro, Black Sesame and more. The ice cream is super creamy and thick. I got the Taro, which could have been more flavorful (using Soft Swerve as a standard), but I did visit on the soft opening so maybe they're still working out some kinks. I will say that the price is definitely on the steeper side. $7 for a cone, and $6 for a cup. So if you're not into the exotic flavors, then a $1 McDonald's cone will probably satisfy your soft serve hankerings. But if you are into some out-of-the-box flavors, then Kuriimii is your place.
name: Kuriimii
categories: Food, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt

text: Yummy variety of snow ice and toppings! Our group got the black sesame ice, mango ice, lychee ice, and matcha ice with a variety of toppings. Delicious! They have a variety of toppings but I wish they had more traditional snow ice/shaved ice toppings.

Definitely want to try black sesame ice cream next time

text: We were here to satisfy an ice cream craving on a super hot day during our trip to Philly. The place blasted the typical club/party music you may find in other trendy dessert spots, but the lack of decor made it feel mostly barren inside. The taro was decent, but black sesame tasted unusually grainy compared to other soft serve places, and it didn't taste much like black sesame... The toppings were less than impressive and I would just skip any extras that weren't included. This was the first soft serve place we happened upon, but next time, I'd hit a different dessert spot instead.

categories: Food, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt

text:
The workers/owner are very nice and also gave out complementary ice cream because they were a few minutes late opening up their store. They really didn't have to - so def service is great! 

I got the charcoal vanilla ice cream and black sesame. My friend got the charcoal vanilla and the taro ice cream. I was hoping they'd have the hot cheeto topping but they didn't. :( This was my first time trying the charcoal vanilla ice cream. It tasted just like vanilla and the fun part was that it made our mouths black. I didn't really enjoy the black sesame like I thought I would but the taro was really goooooood and dense(?) - it wasn't liquidy either. I think I'd go back for the taro if I were to go back. Also, you gotta eat fast or else your ice cream will melt - might be cause we went on a really hot day.....

Also, even if we were to have paid for the ice cream, the price was not bad at all. You also get 2 free toppings(?), which I thought was pretty nice!
name: Kuriimii
categories: Food, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt

text:
Went on grand opening, a lot of people as expected but lines were quick! I got the black sesame matcha swirl with green tea toppings which are my fave.. super soft, perfect amount of sweetness, and def satisfied my soft swerve cravings  
 
Can't wait to try all of the other flavors. Will def come back!! #softswerve #phillylove
name: Kuriimii
categories: Food, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt

text: Went to the grand opening because of their BOGO promo. Tried 5/6 flavours (no taro for me). Was a bit disappointed that they didn't have ube like they did at their soft opening but the black sesame made up for it ! It's hard to find black sesame ice cream in this city, so I'm glad Kuriimii has it. Whoever said the ice cream was too sweet is crazy. Knocked off a star due to pricing since it's just soft serve.
name: Kuriimii
categories: Food, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt

text:
a ton of instagrammable ice cream locations popping up in chinatown, like a liquid nitrogen one next door or rolled up ice cream. must have a ton of competition, but I think this place is worth it out of all. it's cheaper than I thought and they give a huge amount of ice cream.

ordered the matcha and black sesame swirl soft serve in a cup (the combination of these two flavors are amazing. bitter and nutty combined. i think the matcha flavor is great but i dont think the black sesame is as good as other places ive been too, could be more flavorful or taste less grainy. they give a huge amount I couldn't finish it. I topped mine off with some fruity pebbles and 2 green tea pocky) and the matcha soft serve in a cone (I highly recommend the matcha only compared to the swirl. the cones are all waffle cones only).

you get 2 free toppings of any choice. they didn't have the charcoal vanilla when I went and had hazelnut instead which sucked. also, maybe it's because we went late at night, it looked like they were sparse in ingredients, and the place didn't seem as clean or tidy. maybe also the all white interior and empty walls, except the menu board, in this huge place doesn't really make it seem cozy or make you want to stay, looks too cheap and plastic. other than that, I would recommend coming here for the matcha ice cream for cheap after eating some greasy Chinese food
name: Kuriimii
categories: Food, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt

text:
This building is the space that Christian's and Redemption formerly occupied. I didn't have the opportunity to go to either on of those restaurants, so actually eating dinner in what was a former church was a whole new experience for me.

From top to bottom, this place is just divine. I love the fact that the restaurant is situated in a "reworked" church, and still has the feel with the stained glass windows and high ceilings. The atmosphere is cozy, yet elegant and everything is just beautiful. The staff here might be the friendliest staff in town. I know that some of you might say it's because the place is so new, but I was greeted by multiple people when I arrived, a few staff members stopped by during dinner to inquire about the meal and I got a friendly goodbye on my way out the door.

I started off with the #gooddecisions cocktail as I looked over the menu. Everything here sounds so amazing, and I like that they have a nice selection of options from seafood and pork to chicken and vegetable dishes. For my appetizers I got the 3 cheese plate which came with the chef's choice of cheeses as well as the rabbit rillette, which is basically a pâté, The cheese was delicious- I wish I could remember exactly what the cheeses were, but I really enjoyed them. The rabbit rillette was out of this world. It was full of flavor and a biscuit came on the side so it could be spread. It was really rich, and if I was just getting a drink and an appetizer here, this is exactly what I would order.

For my entree, I got the whole smoked fish, charred eggplant, house yogurt, eggplant & black sesame seed purée. The fish is indeed a whole fish which comes with the bones in and head on. It was delicious! The fish had enough meat on it that the bones being in it wasn't a problem at all and they were fairly easy to "pick out". The fish had a smoky flavor that was good without being overwhelming. The eggplant was perfectly roasted and the yogurt was a nice touch and mellowed out the flavor of the fish a bit- it was a nice balance of flavors.

I loved my experience here and I am excited to return. On the night I was here the crowd was pretty thin, but I am sure that this place will definitely "take off" once word gets out about how good it is.
name: Vessel NOLA

text:
Nestled right in the middle of philly Chinatown, Kuriimii is the perfect place for your mid-night sweet tooth cravings (they're open until 12am on the weekends)  They offer a variety of interesting soft serve flavors that is new to philly, and include an unlimited amount of toppings. The staff are very friendly and the ambiance is very chill. It definitely feels like a philly-take on soft serve! Whether it be after your afternoon lunch, or after a couple drinks at the local bars, I highly recommend the soft serve here as a means of satisfying your sweet tooth. I personally love the black sesame soft serve on a chocolate waffle cone! 

(Attached is the honeydew cone - also recommended if you love melona bar ice cream. I ate my black sesame cone too quick to snap a pic)
name: Kuriimii
categories: Food, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt

text:
I came here for my birthday dessert with my family. I knew this will be sweet overload, so after my birthday brunch in center city we decided to walk here from 13th and Walnut. Arctic Scoop is on E. Passyunk near 13th St. It is a small store with very limited seating. Fortunately, when we went we were the only customers so we grabbed the only table that will seat four people. Soon after that more people came in. 

On their menu board you can see the ice cream flavours, toppings, etc. When we went they only had about 6 flavours, but I thought that was enough. I really wanted to try their lychee lavender ice cream, but I didn't see it. Workers will happily let you taste different flavours, so after tasting pandan I knew I wanted that. My daughter ordered black sesame, and I thought it tasted good, but for me the flavour was a bit too intense. I think from few years ago Philly has caught onto selling egg waffles, but all the egg waffles I have seen sold around here are kind of expensive. I am used to paying $1 - $2 in SE Asia, so definitely a sticker shock. However, if you like egg waffles Arctic Scoop does a good job. 

I think Arctic Scoop truly serves good ice cream with great customer service. All the workers are really friendly and helpful. This is a place to splurge trying out different and unique ice cream flavours and toppings. Just remember the limited seating, and also, if you get too many toppings it's really difficult to eat because toppings keep on spilling.
name: Arctic Scoop
categories: Juice Bars & Smoothies, Coffee & Tea, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt, Food, Desserts

text:
My review will be biased from one drink

Service:4/5
Decor: 4/5
Drink: 0/5

Friendly service. Neat decor with sofas. This place was crowded and the line gets long.
I got the Black sesame boba had gooey boba and I wasn't a fan of that. The black sesame tasted watered down.

text:
My first experience with snow cream! Winterfell is a good dessert option if you want something unique and relatively light. Happy I got a chance to try it before the school year starts and it's overrun by students. With multiple exciting flavors and toppings, a GoT theme, board games galore, and late night hours, I am sure business will explode once Penn is back in session. 

Flavors are hit or miss - go for the Taro or the Black Sesame. I was most excited to try their Matcha flavor and was disappointed to find it bland and chalky. Mochi and condensed milk drizzle are a must, as well as the variety of fresh fruits. A bit pricey, but portions are generous. You can easily share a small with a friend. Be warned: your grass jelly topping will harden and freeze into a weird sludgy version of what it once was.
name: Winterfell Dessert

text: Def my favorite soft serve spot! There are a lot of flavors and toppings to choose from but my favorite flavor is definitely the honeydew & black sesame. The interior is also very nice and roomy. Would definitely recommend
name: Kuriimii
categories: Food, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt

text:
The staff was very friendly and offered samples along with suggestions on their most popular flavors. They probably have to explain the flavors a lot but they did not seem tired or annoyed of answering question.

I got the original egg waffle with pandan ice cream. I don't usually get toppings but with free unlimited toppings, how could I not? I got regular and black sesame mochi and a condensed milk drizzle. I was a bit surprised when it came with a chocolate and matcha Pocky. But no complaints here.

I haven't had egg waffle since I was a kid visiting Hong Kong, which was about 15 years ago. So I was pretty excited and this did not disappoint. I've had pandan before but the flavor wasn't subtle like I thought it would be. It went well with the egg waffle. I'll probably be back to try the coconut bowl and other flavors!
name: Arctic Scoop
categories: Juice Bars & Smoothies, Coffee & Tea, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt, Food, Desserts

text:
I am SO excited a Asian soft serve place opened up in Philly. I somehow stumbled across this place on Instagram and knew I had to try it immediately. When I went in the cold, rainy weather, there were still a few other customers inside. The staff was really helpful in helping us pick out flavors. They also give samples, which is a huge plus. I ended up getting a green tea + black sesame swirl with condensed milk and fruity pebbles. It was so good! The ice cream was super creamy, and the serving size was HUGE. The cone presentation itself was very aesthetically pleasing, and we weren't the only ones taking pictures of our food. 

Overall,  I would definitely come back here again. I originally wanted to try the charcoal vanilla because it looked interesting, but they were sold out of that flavor for the night. Next time!
name: Kuriimii
categories: Food, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt

text:
Came here for the soft opening and can I just say this place is absolutely adorable. The workers were so friendly despite me asking to try basically every flavor! I ended up sticking to my all time favorite black sesame. I haven't found any other places in the area with the same kinds of flavors, which definitely makes this place stand out. However, the flavors were a bit weak for me. Some of the flavors I tried just tasted like cream to me... but the black sesame was still pretty good. They have unlimited toppings and cinnamon, chocolate, and vanilla cones. I must say I really did enjoy that cinnamon cone-- maybe more than the actual ice cream. 
I will probably end up returning to this place since I haven't found another place in the area with the same flavors.
name: Kuriimii
categories: Food, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt

text: Really chic and modern store selling really good soft serve. My personal fave is the green tea and black sesame!
name: Kuriimii
categories: Food, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt

text:
Very nice restaurant in downtown Santa Barbara.  Modern decor, great food, excellent service.  Happy hours are 5PM - 7PM on weeknights and offer discounted prices on some drinks and food.

What we ordered:
- Crispy duck salad - excellent, very tasty and great texture
- Crispy rice salad - excellent
- Signature wings* - excellent, unusual taste but delicious
- Egg noodles* - good
- Crispy brussels sprouts* - excellent
- Black pepper tofu and broccolini - good
- Black sesame tres leche - looks ugly but tastes prety good
- Blue ginger marguerita* - good
- Mule kick* - good

* denote that item is available on happy hour menu at a discounted price
name: Sama Sama Kitchen

text: The spot is cute and modern. Seems like a great place to hang out while enjoying a dessert! I was so excited to finally have a soft serve ice cream spot in the city but was a bit disappointed. We got the matcha soft serve with pocky, green tea kit kats, and condensed milk. The texture of the ice cream was strange since there were little tiny bubbles or powder or something that made it gritty. The little particles were quite unpleasant and I actually did not finish the ice cream because of that. There are, however, lots of choices of flavors (today they also had black sesame, charcoal vanilla, Vietnamese coffee, taro, and honeydew) and unlimited toppings so maybe there's a better flavor. For $6 though I might as well get ice cream elsewhere.
name: Kuriimii
categories: Food, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt

text:
Tried my first Kuriimii cone during their soft opening and regardless of soft opening or not, they did really well, ran smoothly and had really good flavors. I had their Honeydew and charcoal vanilla which were both really good. i also tasted Taro, Black Sesame, Matcha which i liked too. Ice cream is super creamy and a large serving so it would be best to share if you can't eat a lot of ice cream. I love their unique flavors and cannot wait to try their featured monthly flavors. I really wanted to try their vietnamese iced coffee, but not sure if it's still available. 
they have such friendly staff, a bright, clean, and welcoming store with a really cute 'Selfie' wall. 
can't wait to make another visit.
name: Kuriimii
categories: Food, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt

text:
Super instagrammable photos of the soft serve here caught my eye, and having just come from a trip to China awash in awesome treats, I found this place irresistible. 

I ordered 1/2 matcha and 1/2 taro soft serve in a cup, topped with oreo crumbs and condensed milk ($5, large enough to share for 2 people). They also had a smaller cup option for $3.50. Pretty reasonable $ - maybe in response to earlier feedback that this place was too expensive.

The perfect presentation practically had me drooling, but as I tried the first few bites, it was just...okay? Not overly sweet, but not as creamy, flavorful, or dense as I've had before. I was also sad not to see black sesame, a flavor that's popped up in a lot of Yelp reviews/photos and part of the reason I was drawn here. The topping bar also looked surprisingly sparse. 

Although the treats here lend themselves to super cool, drool-worthy photos, there's some cost-cutting corners that don't make this place a hit in my book. Sparse topping and flavor selection/quality compared to other places (plus, I barely received a few drizzles of condensed milk on my $5 ice cream), donuts advertised on the chalk board that weren't there, something off about the interior design and location in Chinatown that makes it difficult to want to linger (if you can, given the limited seating), understaffed service (only 1 employee making soft serve 1 at a time on a Friday afternoon). Maybe I came at a bad time, but this was right before the weekend crowds are supposed to roll in. 

Kuriimii is a unique soft serve spot in Chinatown with lots of potential. The beautiful Insta-worthy photos already draw first-timers like me in, but it'll need to set the bar higher to bring me back. Hopefully they do, because I would return WAY more often in that case!
name: Kuriimii
categories: Food, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt

text: This new gem has Asian inspired ice cream flavors. There aren't many flavors but they let you sample whatever you want first. My least favorite was the black sesame seed one but by far taro was the best out of the ones I tried. Cute spot would go again. The best part is it's soft serve ice cream and not rolled like everything else in Chinatown.
name: Kuriimii
categories: Food, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt

text: Flavors seem to rotate in and out.  I was hoping to try black sesame when we came, but it wasn't one of the choices so we went with matcha and mango.  Both pretty good, but I wasn't a fan of the flecks in the matcha flavor - gave it a gritty mouth feel.  If you're familiar with the infamous Dole Whip made popular by Disney, Kuriimii has a non-dairy pineapple soft serve version that is pretty reminiscent if you ever need to get your fix.
name: Kuriimii
categories: Food, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt

text: Great new addition to the Philly Chinatown scene. The ice cream is creamy and flavorful. It's proven to be a solid choice for dessert when in the area. Recommend: black sesame (my favorite) and match green tea. Don't forget to ask for samples, if it's your first time!
name: Kuriimii
categories: Food, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt

text:
This place just opened about 1-2 weeks ago. There are many flavors, some exotic and some more common Asian flavors, including taro, charcoal vanilla, black sesame, and matcha. You can get it in a cup or add $1 for a waffle cone, then you can choose UNLIMITED toppings!!! I got the charcoal and Vietnamese coffee swirl in a cinnamon cone. 

The coffee soft serve is really good. Very strong coffee flavor. I personally am not a fan of the charcoal flavor. Besides adding grainy texture and black color, it doesn't taste like anything and the vanilla base flavor is less milky and more sugary than my tasting. Next time I want to try the other flavors!

I have to give credit to the owner. He came over as I was about to throw away the rest of the waffle cone to inquire my feedback. I was honest about the cone being stale and not crispy. He then insisted to refund me the $1...even though I really didn't need him to. I do appreciate and want to recognize his effort to provide high-quality products to his customers. Just for that, I will recommend you to try this place!
name: Kuriimii
categories: Food, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt

text: We stumbled upon this place after leaving a delicious Chinese food restaurant and decided to give this a try. We tried the J.S. which consist of shaved ice, mochi, black sesame seeds, sprinkles, cookies and cream. The mochi was chewy but it was sweet so I ate it because I'm a sugar addict. The shaved ice tasted like peanut butter. I was pleasantly surprised and highly recommend trying it. The owner is very friendly.
name: Winterfell Dessert

text:
Wowwwww just went here again last night for a private event and the food was TO DIE FOR. 
Pinot noir: Grade A
Hamachi: A
Goat cheese with strawberries and black sesame granola: A
Wild arugula and peaches: A
Grilled CA asparagus w/ burrata: A+ 
Spring orecchiette pasta: A. Unique and tasty!
Roasted Ocean Trout: A+ WOWOWOWOW
I don't eat meat, but had the brown butter cornbread that came with the lamb and the black pepper grits that came with the short rib and they were fantastic!!!
For dessert, even though I was stuffed, I had a few bites of the Valrhona chocolate cake and Meyer lemon mousse- not surprisingly they were both incredible tasting and unique!
Would come again and hopefully ASAP!

text:
Was so excited this place opened up in Philly, since I felt like I'd been missing out on the soft serve scene for quite a while. To be honest, my experience was a bit meh.

My boyfriend wanted to order the Pumpkin Spice swirled with Charcoal Vanilla. However, we were informed they did not have Charcoal Vanilla that day - a huge disappointment, given that this is one of their biggest selling points. Also, it was about 1-2pm on a weekend, not the end of the day or anything. My boyfriend ended up ordering the Pumpkin Spice and Taro instead - surprisingly, not a bad combination. We got condensed milk and oreo crumbles on top. Taro is great, it's light and not overly sweet, without an overwhelming taro flavor, would recommend. Hard pass on the Pumpkin Spice - it's way too sweet, we were sick of it after a few bites.

I ordered the Black Sesame and Matcha swirl on a chocolate cone - I've been drooling after similar soft serve pictures on Instagram for a couple years now. I opted for strawberry Pocky and green tea Pocky as toppings. This did not disappoint - I'd highly recommend this combination. It's definitely not too sweet, and I think people that generally don't like sweets would enjoy this dessert. Black Sesame and Matcha is a match made in heaven.

I wasn't expecting Kuriimii to be cheap, since it's obviously a trendy spot, but it's a bit hard to justify $5 for a cup and $6 for a cone. Unlike some of the older pictures, toppings are NOT unlimited anymore - you get 2 toppings with each purchase, additional toppings are 50 cents. As y'all may know, ya girl is a fan of unlimited toppings; I think it's an easy thing to offer at little expense to the vendor and great joy to customers. They have a great selection of available toppings, so I really hope they return to offering unlimited (or at least 3, c'mon) toppings soon.

Maybe my expectations are high, but I think Kuriimii is going to have trouble keeping up with the soft serve trend AND competing with the existing hoards of Chinatown ice cream shops if they don't make some changes. I don't think I'd choose this place over Teassert, A La Mousse, or T-Swirl. That being said, I'd return for the Black Sesame and Matcha swirl if I was craving it, and to try the Charcoal Vanilla - hence 3/5 instead of 2/5.
name: Kuriimii
categories: Food, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt

text:
Yum! There was a lot of hype about this place on Facebook, and I was worried that it wouldn't be up to its hype, but surprise! It is!

I've tried the Taipei special, the boyfriend special, and one that we made ourselves (black sesame, red beans, grass jelly, condensed milk & wafer sticks). 

The matcha and the taro were both really good and full of taste, whereas the black sesame base is a little more subtle but still yummy. Great texture of shaved ice that is Taiwanese style & the 1 extra free topping for checking in or liking on FB is an awesome deal. I really love the wafer sticks as they add a great crunch and taste to the texture of the shaved ice.

The price is also really good, considering how much these would go in NYC or in Koreatown in LA (although maybe that's not a fair comparison :P) 

5 stars!! I hope that the prices & quality stay consistent as it surely will attract more customers!

Oh and. "Hold the door" is written on the entrance door for all of you that know all the emotions that this phrase invokes. :'(
name: Winterfell Dessert

text:
With the new rolled ice cream fad slowly fading away, there's been a strong contender for its successor and that's soft served ice cream with Asian flavors!!!

I personally love the texture and consistency of soft served ice cream more than anything so I may be a bit bias, but you can't argue with the flavors. There's so many unique Asian flavors that are constantly being updated and a wide variety of toppings to choose from!

My classic go-to option is the black sesame because I just love black sesame. It's a hard flavor to describe, but it's definitely worth sampling when you are there! 

Overall, it's a nice place to hangout after dinner and enjoy some sweets with friends for an affordable price!
name: Kuriimii
categories: Food, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt

text:
We came during the Prix fixe deals, which is the best I could find in Tampa. So I've been there at least 10 times, the manager even knows us. He is a cool and friendly dude, always comes up to us if he see us.

The food is amazing. My husband had the best lobster bisque here (he likes to think hes a lobster bisque expert) It has a Asian twist (coconut milk and curry paste I think) which makes wonderful flavor. Sushi is also amazing, or my husband says so coz I dont eat sushi ( yes, I am ashamed as an Asian) However, I strangely love their sunrise roll. Its cooked and fried. Its so good that I forgot its sushi, they cheated a little by the drying lol. I love the rib so much but its definitely messy, not for a first date. Our favorite is the lobster tempura, which is discontinued. Its not just goood because it is lobster but more about the aioli/sauce and black sesame. Afterthat, nothing is the same again. They have beautiful presentation. 

For entree, we tried the Sampler Trio, Bone in Ribeye, Filet Mignon, and Lobster. Our favorite is the ribeye with truffle mac and cheese with BACON. The best dessert is hand down the souffle. It is not quite the same as other souffle I have. Its more like lava cake and very chocolatey. The rasberry sauce and vanilla bean compliment the dish so well. I burned my tongue twice because I was too excited and ate the hot lava as soon as it oozes out. 
Fortunately, the third time I was about to do it again my husband stopped me coz he knows too well. My husband loves the pineapple upside down cake too. Oh, and the 1980 is so good, it doesnt taste too much alcohol, which could be quite dangerous lol
name: Roy's Restaurant

text:
Came here for the soft opening and was pleasantly surprised with how well everything ran! There are about 7 tables with 2-4 seats each and the space modern and clean and super grammable lol. You can try all the flavors--they had honeydew (my favorite), matcha, charcoal vanilla, black sesame, taro, and avocado. No ube sadly because it's too expensive to make and too difficult to perfect (edit: Michael reached out to me and let me know ube will be available during the grand opening SO EXCITED!!!)

A cone with unlimited toppings (including pocky, various cereals, toasted marshmallow) will set you back $7 which is a bit on the steep side but for the amount of ice cream and the quality of the flavors, it was worth it! 

Would definitely come back to get other flavors!

EDIT: id actually appreciate Kuriimii a lot more if they offered other pricing options so that we aren't forced to pay a single price for unlimited toppings. Like why if I didn't want any toppings? Or only wanted one? I don't wanna pay $6-7 just for soft serve! Charge a more reasonable amount for no toppings or just 1 topping!
name: Kuriimii
categories: Food, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt

text: Probably the best shaved ice place in Philly, hands down. From what I gathered when I first visited, it was originally from NYC and they decided to expand and boy am I glad that they decided to do so to Philly cuz the city sure could use a good place like this. In terms of how it works, you pick a size (Regular, Large, T.B.O.), a flavor base (Mango, Strawberry, Black Sesame, Lychee, Matcha Green Tea, Taro, or Honeydew), toppings ($0.50 each), and a drizzle to finish (Chocolate Sauce, Condensed Milk, Whipped Cream, Salted Caramel, Strawberry Puree, Peanut Butter Sauce, Marshmellow Creme, or Honey. I ended up getting a regular (more than enough for one person, in my opinion) matcha green tea, assorted toppings, and condensed milk for my drizzle. Boy did the result not disappoint. The shaved ice consistency and texture here is the real deal ... not as good as the real deal in Taiwan but for the States, more than adequate and blowing similar average places like these out of the water. Incredibly yummy overall as my mouth and stomach were really happy and the best part is that this particular kind of dessert is light on the diet in terms of calories. I definitely recommend a visit here for sure!
name: Winterfell Dessert

text:
I am way more impressed with Kuriimii now than when I first attended the soft opening. At that time, it was pricey, for $7 a cone with unlimited toppings, which were quite limited, and charcoal vanilla had a dollar premium. Now, it's $6 a cone ($5 for a cup) with 2 free toppings (each additional for 50 cents). The constant flavors seem to be matcha, black sesame, charcoal vanilla, and taro. Strawberry and pumpkin spice were new additions this visit-the strawberry was lighter in flavor, while the pumpkin spice was just strong and sweet enough. It is really nice to be able to pick two flavors even if they aren't already swirled together, and have them either side-by-side or stacked. The toppings have expanded to include crushed nuts and gold flakes (though this has an additional charge). I am looking forward to seeing Kuriimii grow as our very own local soft serve jawn, as finally, I can stop thinking about how far away I am from Soft Swerve in NYC. 

What I'll be back for: new flavors and the friendly staff!
name: Kuriimii
categories: Food, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt

text: Cute place to stop for ice cream.  Unique flavors like black sesame, charcoal vanilla, matcha, lychee etc ...some flavors vary per day. Also different flavors of cones to choose from. 2 toppings included when you buy a cone or cup.
name: Kuriimii
categories: Food, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt

text: I think I found my favorite soft-serve in the Chinatown area of Philly. Located not too far from the Chinatown Friendship Gate, this little joint is known to serve up some rather gnarly soft serve combinations. You can choose either cup ($5) or cone ($6), which comes in either vanilla, chocolate, or cinnamon. There are a total of six soft serve flavors that you can choose from: matcha, black sesame, nutella, charcoal vanilla, honeydew, and taro. Not to mention an assortment of toppings to choose from; first two are on the house, any additional is $0.50 per. As this was my first time here, I chose to get a selection of four flavors (matcha, black sesame, charcoal vanilla, nutella) in one cup with a cinnamon cone on top along with assorted toppings. The nutella is definitely my favorite flavor hands down. It's literally tastes just like nutella in soft serve form ... which is quite legit. The matcha is also pretty authentic although I found it to be a tad too bitter for my liking. Black sesame is also pretty good although it could be a little less grainy. And charcoal vanilla ... what an interesting flavor to write about. Tasted just like vanilla, the charcoal ... didn't really add or take away from the flavor. The cinnamon cone is mad legit ... quite yummy and delicious. Overall, most reasonable prices for great tasting soft serve. Would definitely recommend to others!
name: Kuriimii
categories: Food, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt

text:
First off, I took me forever to figure out the pun from their name. The same isn't said for their ice cream; their quality and service did not miss the mark. I have been a few times, so I have tried their charcoal, pumpkin spice (seasonal), black sesame, and matcha flavors. My favorite is the black sesame. So much flavor !

It is roughly $5-7 depending if you get a cup or cup then some extra cents for the taxes. You get two toppings with your purchase but can definitely get more for additional cost. I've read a few reviews about their recent reduction in cost, which is good but keep in mind it's only because of good constant business and service. Overall, I dig this place and trying to take my friend here tonight even though it's Fall.
name: Kuriimii
categories: Food, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt

text:
i have nothing but good to say about the lark and the wine bistro behind.... we arrived a little early for our dinner reservation so we sat at the bar at les marchands for a delightful, refreshing glass of wine. wonderful environment! we moved over to the lark where we sat a a booth where we could see all that was going on. we had such great service. the food kept coming, and it amazed me;  each dish served at the table got better and better (and it wasn't because of the moscow mules consumed). our party decided to share all the dishes we ordered. we started with the charcuterie plate, pork belly sliders, little gem wedge, the beet salad along with the fried olives. we moved onto the marys roasted chicken - so moist and simple yet flavorful. each dish came out at the perfect time, and each dish was more and more exceptional.  i just might have to go back for the desserts!!!  the milk chocolate pot de creme (an absolute, even if you are not a dessert person),  the cheesecake, black sesame dacquoise, and ice cream sandwich - we did share all of those with coffee. a great ending!
i can't get back soon enough. time to make another reservation!! thank you for such a wonderful evening!
ps...i had to go back the next morning to the lucky penny for a warm scone and latte! perfection!
name: The Lark

text:
I've been following them since they opened. I read all the reviews, their recipes are original, the business itself seemed like it was a game changer in the baked goods community so I was dying to pay them a visit. This week I did. 
I love their location on Mag st and 9th st. It's a quite place beautifully set with natural light. Good for family, friends or when flying solo. 
Their carrot cake is very moist, I loved finding black sesame seeds. It gave a crunchy addition to the soft cake. The cream cheese icing was nice. Robust in texture but not overly sweet. 
Rye brownies are very rich in flavor, they have cocoa nibs and maldon salt. These are also moist and soft but do hold their shape quiet well. 
Croissants buttery and soft.
name: Levee Baking Co.
categories: Bakeries, Food, Coffee & Tea

text:
The name is no coincidence, Winterfell Dessert is all about the superficial homage to Game of Thrones with flavors that remind you of the critical scenes from the series, but that's about it.

Must get: taipei, king of the north
Meh: kiss me
Missed out: waffles

I love Hong Kong style shaved ice, which is more of an ice cream with finely shaved and creamy texture than the Italian cousins. The only downside is the cost, which a small (while sizable) portion is quite expensive, even with all of the trimmings. I love the green tea flavoring of taipei and thought the grass jelly added that extra texture. As for the king of the north, you can't go wrong with the black sesame, but I think the vanilla cookies could have been exchanged for something less sweet. Unfortunately, 'kiss me' was the most bland and I did not have much love for the original flavor.

Ultimately, this establishment carried a much greater hipster vibe than a Game of Throne vibe, but you can't argue against the quality of the food, which is what matters.

Sadly, this is not a geekout ice shop.

Food: 5 stars
Price: 3 stars
Service: 4 stars
Ambiance: 4 stars
name: Winterfell Dessert

I had a huge craving for bubble tea and lo & behold, while Yelp-ing, my friends & I found this place! I love the fact that they have authentic Asian flavors (my go-to is the black sesame) & you have the options of using other milks and altering the sugar level!

Thanks for being a life saver in my boba crisis!

text: When I saw this was opening in Philly I got super excited. I am a huge lover of green tea and taro flavored soft serve ice-cream. I got the cup which was I think was around $6? Kinda of expensive but I shared it with 2 friends. I think getting the cup is the best way to go because it seems like you get more ice cream and it is cheaper than getting it in the cone. I was able to try the green tea swirled with black sesame and it was really good! Super rich, thick, and creamy, my goodness. However, I was kind of unimpressed with their topping choices. I ended up putting Oreo crumbs on it with 2 green tea pocky sticks. I really wanted Mochi but they didn't have any.. I will definitely be back to try their Taro flavor!
name: Kuriimii
categories: Food, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt

text:
We all try to eat healthy. But sometimes it's hard to have all the right ingredients on hand AND the motivation to chop a million vegetables before they start to grow mold. That's where CoreLife Eatery comes in, a new whole-food chain that recently made its way to Indianapolis in the Castleton area. They claim to be non-GMO and locally sourced with no high fructose corn syrup or artificial colors and flavors and their branding looks like a bright Chipotle. Similar to other fast-casual restaurants that are worming their way into Millennial's hearts and pockets, the restaurant offers grain, salad, and broth bowls that can be customized into a myriad of healthy offerings.

This might sound a little complicated, but it's basically like building a big salad. You pick an already-decided combination from the hanging board or design your own dish, adding things like tuna poke, black sesame seeds, and chopped almonds on top of quinoa and kale. Most bowls have a suggested dressing, which have been prepared fresh, in-house the same day. The chain also offers creative, hand-crafted beverages, such as beet lemonade or apple cider green tea.

CoreLife Eatery was really clogging my Instagram feed, so I decided to give it a try last Sunday with Husband in tow. It was pouring down rain outside, so we ran into an almost empty restaurant (sharp contrast to the lines out the door from the previous week) to see what all the fuss was about. The verdict? Underwhelming. I tried the Tuna Poke grain bowl with miso sesame ginger dressing and Husband ordered the Thai chicken with rice noodles and Thai cashew dressing. My bowl looked pretty and colorful, but became super soggy with too much dressing and the flavors all muddled together into a bland mess after a few bites. Husband's bowl was pretty bland and he was disappointed with the cold noodles and overwhelming amount of cabbage. Both bowls needed some salt or spice or something. There was also a super weird 1/2 slice of store-bought bread that accompanied my dish as a "side," but no other side options (I need my kettle chips!). I sampled almost all of the fruit beverages and was very let down with the taste and sweetness without finding any favorites.

I like so many ideas from CoreLife Eatery, like the protein-rich bowls, antibiotic-free meats, and pretty affordable entrees (around $10), but there has got to be a way to make them more palatable. Husband ran to Wendy's an hour later. If I went again, I would order something different and definitely ask for dressing on the side. Or maybe I just won't go again.
name: CoreLife Eatery

text:
Came here last week with my SO because I love ice cream and I love it EVEN MORE when it's shaved and snowy with toppings and color changing spoons! I actually didn't love the shaved ice as much as I do "snowdays" in NY, but it's still really solid. PLUS the staff is really great and I love the space!

If you've ever been to 'Snowdays' the concept is really similar, with the choice of a base shaved ice cream flavor*, toppings for $.50 each*, "dressings" which are free*, and three sizes of cups (Regular $5, Large $6.5, Mountain $8.5). The other option is to get one of their "specials" which are pre-decided mixes*. ($6 regular, $8 large, $10 mountain).

*Ice cream flavors:black sesame, green tea, taro, honeydew, mango, strawberry, lychee 
*Toppings: almonds, pocky sticks, seasonal fruit, grass jelly, mochi, egg pudding, etc.
*"Dressings": condensed milk, strawberry puree, etc.
*Pre-decided mixes:
         -Boyfriend: taro, red bean, fruity pebbles, etc. 
         -Taipei: Matcha, grass jelly, red bean, mochi, condensed milk

I decided on the J.S. (John Snow) but didn't love the idea of vanilla cookies and cream, so the staff (graciously!) let me do a swap out for strawberries. ALSO when we were rung up I realized after paying that I was charged for a regular when I wanted a large, and the cashier was really great about it and gave me the large cup for no additional cost (so with that plus the 25% check in discount it ends up being super cheap). 

Hung around for a bit after eating to watch batman (which they had on the TV) and play chess! 
Definitely worth a visit!
name: Winterfell Dessert

text:
An instagrammable soft serve shop with flavors that remind me of traditional Asian soft serve places (matcha, black sesame, strawberry, charcoal vanilla, taro). 

A cup is $5 and a cone is $6; it comes with 2 free toppings, with additional toppings 50 cents each. Seems a little pricey, but they do give you a hefty amount of ice cream, so it's definitely shareable. Service is great and the seating, bathroom, etc. are clean. There's also free wifi! Great place to grab dessert.
name: Kuriimii
categories: Food, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt

text: I ABSOLUTELY LOVE THIS PLACE! The food and vibe are spot on for the casual cool place that it is. What really has me singing its praises is the food. It's so absolutely delicious. They were able to make most dishes vegan per my friend's dietary restrictions. I'd say the Mie Goreng is even better without the fish sauce because I tried both versions! We ALL loved the Crispy Brussel Sprouts, the Potato Wedges, the Rice Pilaf, the Crispy Duck Salad, the Crispy Rice Salad, and the Black SesameTres Leches. The Krupuk + Sambal and Signature WIngs were good. The staff was great. I can't wait to come back.
name: Sama Sama Kitchen

text: Ooooof. I went here a while back as soon as they had opened with a friend. She's a foodie and had heard the hype about this place and their Vietnamese Coffee ice cream?? Amazing!! I am biased though as someone who just enjoys any viet coffee flavored thing- although I did also try their matcha green tea and black sesame ice creams (which were also amazing). Can't wait til' they reopen. Worth the hype.
name: Kuriimii
categories: Food, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt

text:
Vibes: bright, casual, fun, nerdy with the funko pop-filled shelves, board games, and GoT shoutouts right from the door, smells like spun sugar

Tasting notes:
-black sesame shaved ice with red beans and condensed milk: fluffy, feathery in texture, light in flavor; the ice becomes like a sticky soft serve when compacted/starts to melt; liked that the red beans were whole and not the paste kind

Other thoughts:
-love that there are DIY and set options for shaved ice in different sizes, a great variety of toppings from nuts to mochi to fruit, egg waffle sundaes, and many flavors of bubble tea (looking at the black sesame milk tea since its harder to find on menus)
-comfy armchairs to lounge and a good handful of tables for dessert dates

Will be back for: more shaved ice and that black sesame milk tea!
name: Winterfell Dessert
attributes: {'DogsAllowed': 'True', 'BikeParking': 'True', 'RestaurantsDelivery': 'True', 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': 'True', 'GoodForMeal': "{'dessert': True, 'latenight': False, 'lunch': False, 'dinner': False, 'brunch': False, 'breakfast': False}", 'RestaurantsPriceRange2': '1', 'RestaurantsTableService': 'False', 'Ambience': "{'romantic': False, 'intimate': False, 'classy': False, 'hipster': False, 'divey': True, 'touristy': False, 'trendy': False, 'upscale': False, 'casual': False}", 'BusinessAcceptsBitcoin': 'False', 'DriveThru': 'False', 'WiFi': "u'free'", 'NoiseLevel': "'average'", 'Alcohol': "u'none'", 'RestaurantsAttire': "'casual'", 'GoodForKids': 'True', 'RestaurantsGoodForGroups': 'True', 'RestaurantsReservations': 'False', 'Caters': 'False', 'HasTV': 'True', 'BusinessParking': "{'garage': False, 'street': True, 'validated': False, 'lot': False, 'valet': False}", 'WheelchairAccessible': 'True', 'RestaurantsTakeOut': 'True', 'OutdoorSeating': 'False'}

text:
Hmmm I was expecting more.
2.5 stars maybe?
They service was friendly and they let you try any and all flavors.
The taro was surprisingly my favorite. Mild in flavor.
The black sesame was okay, but a bit of a strange, almost artificial aftertaste. 
Pumpkin spice also had a fakeness to it.
Strawberry was decent and also mild in flavor.
Overall, The soft serve is smooth and sweet. I was pretty underwhelmed though from all the hype I heard. Not dying to go back.
name: Kuriimii
categories: Food, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt

text:
I've tried something almost identical to this place in California, called Fluff Ice. So I'm very much familiar with the texture of this shave ice and the toppings. 

The shave ice is definitely very fluffy and it has a nice smooth texture to it. If you have never had something similar to this, give it a try. This doesnt really have a wow factor because I've had something like this before. But judging from the taste and flavors that they offer, this place is pretty good. I got the mango and black sesame flavor with rainbow jelly, oreos, and condense milk for my topping. Sesame flavor was much sweeter than I had liked but the mango flavor was awesome. 
Perfect for a nice hot day.  

Workers were really nice as well!
name: Winterfell Dessert
attributes: {'DogsAllowed': 'True', 'BikeParking': 'True', 'RestaurantsDelivery': 'True', 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': 'True', 'GoodForMeal': "{'dessert': True, 'latenight': False, 'lunch': False, 'dinner': False, 'brunch': False, 'breakfast': False}", 'RestaurantsPriceRange2': '1', 'RestaurantsTableService': 'False', 'Ambience': "{'romantic': False, 'intimate': False, 'classy': False, 'hipster': False, 'divey': True, 'touristy': False, 'trendy': False, 'upscale': False, 'casual': False}", 'BusinessAcceptsBitcoin': 'False', 'DriveThru': 'False', 'WiFi': "u'free'", 'NoiseLevel': "'average'", 'Alcohol': "u'none'", 'RestaurantsAttire': "'casual'", 'GoodForKids': 'True', 'RestaurantsGoodForGroups': 'True', 'RestaurantsReservations': 'False', 'Caters': 'False', 'HasTV': 'True', 'BusinessParking': "{'garage': False, 'street': True, 'validated': False, 'lot': False, 'valet': False}", 'WheelchairAccessible': 'True', 'RestaurantsTakeOut': 'True', 'OutdoorSeating': 'False'}

text:
Love Kuriimii! Perfect soft serve that really hits the spot. My favorite flavors are black sesame, matcha, taro, and lychee. 

I love that they added smaller sizes for cheaper ($3.50) so you don't have to commit to the larger sizes. You can also get two free toppings (love the pocky sticks and fruity pebbles)

Definitely check out kuriimii if you wanna enjoy some awesome ice cream!
name: Kuriimii
categories: Food, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt

text: This jawn just opened and they offer a variety of soft serve jawns. I tried the black sesame jawn, matcha jawn, and the avocado jawn. They also offer different flavored cones like chocolate or vanilla, and if you don't like cones, they got a cup to serve the jawns in em. All them jawns were poppin and I can't wait to try the other jawns! Perfect dessert after having dinner in Chinatown.
name: Kuriimii
categories: Food, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt

text:
An excellent addition to the area for your dessert needs. If you're craving a soft serve, this is the place! I met one of the owners Union who runs a very professional spot with his partners. Let's dive into it:

Place - love the clean looking decor, very modern. Once you walk in you'll find only a handful of seats. You'll see that they have a huge chalkboard menu to see what they have to offer, which means to me that they can easily change up the flavors which is a great thing. Place seemed well kept and clean.

Service - people working behind the counter look young AF!!! But they listen and try their best, so I can't say anything bad about that. Keep hiring the pretty ladies ! 

Soft serve ice cream:

Black sesame - it was good but a little under sesame'd. 
Honeydew - sweet! Reminds me of a melona bar. 
Viet coffee - bits of coffee bits ? Little bit of a gritty feel. 
Taro - the winner. Not too sweet & not bland. Get this. 

Fix the above issues I mentioned and you'll be straight. 

They are new but I had an excellent experience here with the Taro flavor, service and was comfy at location. Good luck and keep up the great work !
name: Kuriimii
categories: Food, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt

text:
I know I've already reviewed The Lark a couple times, but every meal I've had here has been noteworthy, including the most recent, four years after our last dinner--four years that encompassed a global pandemic and the birth of our child, both events that have only made me love a good restaurant even more. The Lark may be the best in town. It's certainly my go-to recommendation whenever friends visit Santa Barbara. 

We'd been wanting to go back ever since we got vaccinated in April, but predictably, it's almost always booked up during reasonable hours. Our dinner, at 8:45 on a Monday night last month, was a special treat, and we enjoyed every minute.

We ate indoors, and the space and service and atmosphere were as we remembered, all very pleasant and exemplary. The Lark's bar is as much of a draw as the food, and I loved both of the cocktails I ordered. The Yankee Point was a lovely daiquiri, made with Wray & Nephew, Denizen white rum, lime, strawberry, and sumac. The Summerland was a beautiful, balanced sour, with Old Overholt bonded rye, Amaro Averna, summer peach, lavender, and lemon.

The food was delicious. We started with oysters on the half shell and the bigeye tuna crudo, both outstanding. The oysters came with watermelon granita, finger lime, and basil, and the tuna in a cool, spicy fermented Fresno chile broth with black sesame, stone fruit, and Thai basil. The next thing to hit the table was a board of Mary's free range duck liver mousse, served with saffron apricots, spicy Iranian pickles, and olive oil crostini. This was a lavish portion of rich, flavorful duck liver mousse with a colorful variety of pickles, which is always what I want with my charcuterie. Grilled Caledonian prawns were meaty and succulent, prepared with black lime, tahini yogurt, cilantro zhoug, compressed cucumber, and mint. Don't sleep on those juicy heads. The centerpiece of our dinner was the grilled prime hanger steak. The steak was perfectly cooked, a rare silky red through the middle, sliced and served over a platter of blistered shishito peppers, smoked beef tallow emulsion, sungold tomato, and crispy Thai basil. We had some vegetables left over (since Matt doesn't eat many vegetables), and I had them with salmon later in the week and they made that easy at-home dinner feel positively luxurious. For dessert, we shared an olive oil cake with jam, peaches, nougat, and ice cream. The least memorable part of our meal but still great.

We had a stellar time at The Lark and can't wait to come back, hopefully before four more years have passed. It's never disappointed us, and I don't expect that it ever will.
name: The Lark

text:
I am going to be honest, I have an obsession with boba drinks. Back home near Chicago, access to boba was a lot easier than out here and I am not going to lie, my expectations were low when I searched for something decent in Nashville. Luckily I am proven wrong when it comes to Royal Boba! I thoroughly enjoyed all the drinks I've had here the classic, black sesame, winter melon and hk style. My go tos seem to be the classic and hk style. I also appreciate that they allow customization of the drinks including your choice of milk, sweetness levels and toppings! 

I have to say I got really lucky as I live about 10 min away. Glad to know Royal boba is around to feed my unhealthy drink addiction !
name: Royal Boba
categories: Food, Tea Rooms, Shaved Ice, Bubble Tea, Coffee & Tea, Desserts

text:
I've been here at least a dozen times since it opened last year because I love it that much. This is the place to go for soft serve ice cream. I've tried the matcha, black sesame, taro, and some of my favorite rotating flavors were watermelon and honeydew. Honeydew was the best flavor of all time and I'm crushed that it's gone. I sampled charcoal vanilla out of curiosity once and it tastes just like vanilla, nothing special, but seems like people get it for the novelty. I saw a girl eating charcoal vanilla once and all her teeth were stained black and it was quite the sight to see. 

The staff is friendly and you can sample all the flavors you want before making your final choice. I usually get a cup with 2 flavors side by side (I don't like when the flavors mix together in the swirl), almost always with taro. I find the matcha to be a little bitter and the black sesame a bit grainy. Then you get 2 free toppings of your choice- I like the Oreo dust and green tea kit kats, or the mochi for an extra $1. The cost is only $5 for a sizeable portion that can be shared between 2 people. My boyfriend and I always leave this place feeling satisfied. We take all our visiting friends and family here for a treat.
name: Kuriimii
categories: Food, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt

text:
At least the price is a *little more reasonable.  Yes, $5 is a lot for soft-serve, but you can't beat the creamy consistency which is thick enough to not become a melted bowl of soupy mess. The flavors are also unique and delicious without being overbearing. Our favorite is the black sesame and matcha swirl - give it a try!  Nothing quite like it at the usual froyo places...

Enjoy!
name: Kuriimii
categories: Food, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt

text: I like this place. The food are pretty good based on the American standard. We ordered the hot chicken bao, sprouts, and egg noodles. They are a little bit sweet, but in a good way. Egg noodle is pretty Asian. The bao is more delicious than I expected. The black sesame cake is very very delicious. Not so sweet and very soft. There is no parking there.
name: Sama Sama Kitchen

text:
The best matcha froyo in Philly! You can see the matcha powder in the froyo, so you know they ain't playing around. There are variety of ways to make your froyo unique, and they have peppero/pocky sticks available. Fun games inside and it's a nice hangout space with friends. All the servers are super nice! 

Highly recommend getting matcha with almond flakes.

If you get the mochi, it's $0.50 for like 5(?) pieces. I believe it was minimalistic mochi serve for artistic purposes. I can't wait to go back and try taro, black sesame, and black vanilla. You can make the flavors half-half, too!
name: Kuriimii
categories: Food, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt

text:
This ice cream shop offers all your favorite trendy Asian flavors in soft serve form. If you're been to soft swerve in NYC, you know exactly what I'm talking about. Flavors include matcha, black sesame, taro, Vietnamese coffee, charcoal vanilla and probably more seasonal flavors to come. 

The biggest draw about this place is definitely the insta-worthy soft serves, especially as they are served with a charcoal cone and come with unlimited toppings like fruity pebbles, picky, kit kats, and oreo dust. Of course, this type of trendiness isn't cheap. Cups are $6 and cones are $7, but this is pretty comparable to the multitudes of rolled ice cream shops in Chinatown. 

Overall, this is a promising ice cream shop and I'd definitely come again, especially as they accept credit/debit as well with no minimum.
name: Kuriimii
categories: Food, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt

text:
I loved the taro ice cream! Hubby got the cookies and cream flavor I think. I did not get a chance to taste his because I was thoroughly enjoying the taro ice cream. If you like taro you will definitely like this ice cream. 

Pros: unlimited toppings if you get a bubble waffle or coconut bowl. Generous portion size, great mochi, pocky included too 
Cons: hard to eat in the container because I was afraid the toppings would fall off. The bubble waffle was not as crisp as I thought it would be. I guess u can't expect crispy due to the ice cream when I have had it before the Hong Kong bubble waffle was crispy but this was a totally different location. It's more like a regular waffle with the ice cream. 
Seating: limited. There was only a bench, some bar seating and then one more picnic bench table set up. 

Overall I would recommend this place to try out their many flavors. They even had a sesame flavor that I did not get to try. It seems to be the flavors rotate, so I'm definitely waiting for black sesame!
name: Arctic Scoop
categories: Juice Bars & Smoothies, Coffee & Tea, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt, Food, Desserts

text:
Ice cream as dark as my soul? Check!

Came here on a Friday night date night for a some sweet indulgence. The shop is cute and right in the middle of all the East Passyunk hustle. It's not too hard to find and the crowd that gathers around definitely serves as a pseudo street marker on spotting it!

Inside it's brightly lit with the days ice cream options displayed towards the left and the register to pay meets you as you keep walking forward. The menu has some great, and unheard of to me, options. This really tickled my curiosity. 

We chose to go with the black sesame flavor in a black vanilla cone with the dark chocolate chips - all black errrthannnggg. The other flavor we grabbed was pandan (a fruity tea leaf flavor) in the same type cone. 

Both options were so good! The flavors were truly infused throughout the frozen treats. Definitely something new and delicious! 

The workers were great in explaining the different flavors and answering our questions. Unfortunately, due to COVID, they were not offering tastings of the flavors. This definitely had us a little uneasy since these flavors were so new to us, we were unsure if we will enjoy. Thankfully we were pleasantly surprised!

The menu offers other options - including fresh waffles, smoothies, and boats - so lots of confectionary goodness to check out! 

Overall - great experience and looking forward to going back and exploring more of the menu.
name: Arctic Scoop
categories: Juice Bars & Smoothies, Coffee & Tea, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt, Food, Desserts

text: I have tried Iceland, Teassert, and Sweet Charlie's rolled ice cream and it all somewhat tastes the same to me. I am a sucker for black sesame so I had to get the Black Sesame ice cream here. It was very creamy and has a subtle nutty taste . The condensed milk made it sweeter, but other than that it was perfect for my taste. I also opted for red bean instead of grass jelly. By the way I love the owner David, he's awesome!
name: I CE NY
categories: Restaurants, Food Court, Food, Desserts, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt

text: First time trying this place and I gotta say, not impress. Got the black sesame flavor and it's not that flavorful. I will give credit that they have unique flavors compare to other roll ice cream shops. The downside is the amount they give you. Toppings are fine but it's the little amount of ice cream that make me want to go somewhere else.
name: I CE NY
categories: Restaurants, Food Court, Food, Desserts, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt

text: This place is great! I got the black sesame with Oreo mixed in with berries and whip cream toppings. It's my second time here and the staff is so nice and the ice cream is made pretty fast. It's so cool watching the ice cream be made. The texture is a little different from normal ice cream. To me it's a little chewy (not bad). The portions are huge but its so good you could finish it easily.
name: I CE NY
categories: Restaurants, Food Court, Food, Desserts, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt

text:
Really good! Bf got pork buns and tonkotsu ramen, which filled him up and left him satisfied. I did the Lent thing and got spring rolls and the grilled mackerel. Delicious. The Japanese mashed potatoes were made with coconut milk, which gave them a tasty unique flavor. Then we tried these chocolate peanut butter marshmallow spring rolls-so good! Somehow we managed to receive some complimentary black sesame ice cream, which was good after the marshmallow thing as it was refreshing and not-as-sugary.
We look forward to going back!
name: Ban Ban Asian Bistro
attributes: {'Alcohol': "u'none'", 'WiFi': "u'free'", 'RestaurantsDelivery': 'True', 'Caters': 'True', 'GoodForMeal': "{'dessert': False, 'latenight': False, 'lunch': True, 'dinner': True, 'brunch': False, 'breakfast': False}", 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': 'True', 'RestaurantsReservations': 'True', 'WheelchairAccessible': 'True', 'GoodForKids': 'True', 'RestaurantsGoodForGroups': 'True', 'OutdoorSeating': 'False', 'BusinessAcceptsBitcoin': 'False', 'RestaurantsPriceRange2': '2', 'DogsAllowed': 'False', 'NoiseLevel': "u'average'", 'HappyHour': 'False', 'HasTV': 'False', 'BikeParking': 'False', 'BusinessParking': "{'garage': False, 'street': False, 'validated': False, 'lot': True, 'valet': False}", 'RestaurantsTableService': 'True', 'RestaurantsTakeOut': 'True', 'Ambience': "{'touristy': False, 'hipster': False, 'romantic': False, 'divey': False, 'intimate': False, 'trendy': True, 'upscale': False, 'classy': True, 'casual': True}", 'RestaurantsAttire': "u'casual'"}

text:
Came to this small corner of Chinatown Square on a Friday night, and it was surprisingly not very packed. We ordered the black sesame base, with lychee mix in but disappointingly, all three topping options we wanted were out (blackberries, raspberries, and mochi) so instead we just went with Kit Kat, blueberries and lychee, and then we got the condensed milk drizzle. The thing cost ~$7, and we waited about 15 minutes for it.

Overall, I can't say the whole experience was exceptional, but it was still good. The ice cream was definitely tasty, and there was a good amount of it, but for $7 there were literally two pieces of Kit Kat, 3 blueberries and maybe 3 pieces of lychee which seemed a little scarce. Perhaps I was just disappointed they didn't have any of my three topping preferences
name: I CE NY
categories: Restaurants, Food Court, Food, Desserts, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt

text: Good spot for ice cream in Chinatown. Was empty when we walked in mid-week at 3pm, so no wait. Ordered, got the afternoon happy hour discount and $1 off for check in to Yelp for a grand total of $9.50 for two treats. Black sesame -- yummy; Vietnamese coffee -- as expected, with a large toasted marshmallow. Only issue might be the wait with a large crowd, as there is only one ice cream roller machine in the store.
name: I CE NY
categories: Restaurants, Food Court, Food, Desserts, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt

text: There are a lot of places in Philly now that serve Thai rolled ice cream, so they do need to compete. We decided to give this place a try because they had some base flavors that we haven't seen at other places such as taro and black sesame. We ordered black sesame expecting some deep sesame flavor to the ice cream, but it really just tasted like cookies & creme. Overall it's tasty and doesn't take too long, but not my favorite place around for rolled ice cream.
name: I CE NY
categories: Restaurants, Food Court, Food, Desserts, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt

text:
Flavors are WONDERFUL. I love the black sesame.

More on the sweeter side, especially if you order with the condensed milk drizzled in. 

Other than that, no complaints. 

Definitely recommend!
name: I CE NY
categories: Restaurants, Food Court, Food, Desserts, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt

text:
Came to Chop Steakhouse and Bar (downtown) last night for Downtown Dining Week 2016 and to celebrate the hubs and my 13th Wedding Anniversary.

We opted for reservations which meant the booth areas upstairs but the walk-in space in the lounge downstairs is probably my favourite here.

Our server and all the staff were pretty fabulous.  Sure there were some mistakes - missing a spoon for soup or water but when asked everyone was super friendly and took care of our needs.  I really liked how any staff member walking by was able to stop and check in on us or ask if we needed anything and our server checked back at the perfect times to make sure we were enjoying our items.

Parking can be a bit tricky here but the East Parkade in City Centre is pretty good and has an access ramp from the 2nd floor of the parkade (still requiring some stairs) that doesn't make you go outside in case it's super cold or rainy.

I absolutely love the look of this location of Chop and you can really see the attention to detail what went into the huge renovation of this space for Chop to open up paired with the Sutton Hotel.

If you haven't been to the lounge - go - it's really something to enjoy.

Anyhow, I digress.

The hubs and I opted for the following from the Downtown Dining Week $28 Menu (there was also a $48 option with killer appetizers like steak bites and crab cakes but we didn't want to have a huge meal at a late setting before bed):


For starters we selected:

Mixed Green Salad
garden vegetables, pumpkin and black sesame seeds with basil honey-lime vinaigrette

Red Pepper Bisque
creamy satin bisque of tomatoes and roasted red peppers

Both were excellent but the basil honey-lime vinaigrette was TO DIE FOR.  Seriously, I wanted to lick the plate and asked the hubs if he would try to replicate this at home!  PHENOMENAL salad and the pumpkin and sesame seeds were just killer with it!

For mains we selected: 

Maple Bourbon Haddock
blackened haddock, seared in a maple bourbon butter, served with wild rice pilaf and fresh seasonal vegetables

Top Sirloin
served with your choice of wasabi infused mashed potatoes, wild rice pilaf, baked potato, Chop cut fries or fresh seasonal vegetables


& I added lobster and gorgonzola for $5 to the Sirloin

Both were excellent.  The steak was cooked to perfection at a warm medium rare.  I loved the lobster and gorgonzola add on!  The hubs was super happy with his blackened haddock.

Both of us commented that we would order the same starters and mains again which is always a great sign!

And for desserts we opted for: 

Tiramisu
espresso soaked sponge, amaretto & mascarpone mousse, shaved chocolate

Warm Apple Crumble
granny smith apples & raspberry compote, brown sugar crumble, vanilla gelato

Both desserts were excellent and presented beautifully.  I loved the classic feel of the crumble in the oval cast iron dish and the tiramisu in a 1/2 size mason jar.  I've had mason jar desserts before that fell flat or didn't seem put together at all.  This one totally hit the mark and was not a consistency I was expecting in that it didn't appear to have layers and felt more like a mix - similar to rice pudding.  The flavour was heavenly and easily rich enough to share between two people.

I had mentioned at the very beginning of dinner that I had a walnut allergy and not only did our server come back several time stop to ask specific questions but the front end manager also stopped by to clarify before delivering the apple crumble to my husband - even the way the front end manager knelt down to our table to discuss my allergy with me at eye level was quite comforting and made us feel that they really cared.

Being that we had a late seating and it was a work night we opted for sparking water instead of wine or cocktails and I was pleased to see that they offer house bottled sparkling water with a little note on the back of the bottle that choosing to support this method is both environmentally responsible and sustainable.  And the price was fair at $3.99 a bottle (2 glasses plus a little extra from each bottle).

To finish off the night our server brought us two glasses of prosecco because she had overheard us talking about our Anniversary.

All in all it was a fabulous meal from service to ambience to presentation to taste of food.  It's not often that I can say I would 100% repeat the same meal bite for bite but I would definitely say that about Chop downtown.

TWO THUMBS WAY UP

As a side note, I had come here back in November as part of the Yelp Rodeo Week food crawl and was absolutely blown away by the food we tried and the knowledge and service we received from Stefan (the sales and special event coordinator).  The steak bites and Tuna tartar were AH-MAZING and the Alcoholic Pink Lemonade blew my mind.  The bone-in ribeye was the best I have ever had!  If you're looking to plan a work party or special event, I can't imagine  a more friendly and knowledgeable sales coordinator than Stefan!
name: Chop Steakhouse & Bar

text:
I hadn't tried rolled ice cream before and was searching Philly for the perfect place to test my tastebuds. Out of the 3-4 rolled ice cream places in Chinatown we stepped into, we picked I CE NY for their unique ice cream flavors (thai tea, ube, black sesame and mango sticky rice to name a few!).

As there aren't many Filipino restaurants in the Philly area, the ube ice cream caught my eye. For $7, the quantity was lacking but the flavor was there. Not as strong as I would expect from ube found in halo halo or Red Ribbon pastries but still enough to give the Filipino thumbs up.
name: I CE NY
categories: Restaurants, Food Court, Food, Desserts, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt

text: I enjoy going to max brenner once in a while when I am in the city. Love the Asian salad and their cocktail drinks. I only gave three stars because they are not consistent with food quality. I got a black sesame salmon one time and they served with leftover vegetables. They were yellowy, saggy looking. Didn't taste fresh. Their smoothies? Way too sweet and liquidy. It didn't taste like how it used to be.

text:
I'm a visitor from the LA area where we are known for our fantastic food and desserts, but this is hands down the best ice cream I have ever had in my almost 21 years of life.

In my four-day trip to Philadelphia, I visited three times and tried five of the flavors. I would've visited everyday, but it closed one of the days before I could get there in time. 

I highly recommend the Mango Sticky Rice, which I ate four times. My next favorite was Taro, followed by Black Sesame, Thai Ice Tea, and Matcha. 

Also shoutout to Tuan, who was the most enthusiastic and helpful employee there. 

I know I'm kind of dramatic, but seriously. Their ice cream changed my life.
name: I CE NY
categories: Restaurants, Food Court, Food, Desserts, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt

text: I love this place!  They took ice cream to a new level!   And I even got to meet Danny!  One of the guys who invented the ice cream roll in Thailand!  He was so nice and he made the ice cream rolls himself for my order.   I had the strawberry cheesecake one yesterday and I just had the black sesame today.  Sooooo goooooooood.  I can't wait to try the other flavors!!
name: I CE NY

text: Visiting from LA and found this place my first night here. I've been here 3 times in 4 days and I'm a huge fan. The black sesame is delicious, banana cream is insanely good, Thai tea is off the chart, coconut is crazy and the mango sticky rice is awesome. The guys who work here are all super nice and it also fun to watch them roll the ice cream.

text: My daughter and I love this place! We tried just about all the other rolled ice cream places in the city and this place not only has the best tasting ice cream and texture but their flavors and combos are the best! I've been here so many times and haven't had a bad combo yet! Strawberry cheesecake, vietnamese coffee, black sesame and mango sticky rice are some of my faves! This is where I bring anyone who wants to try rolled ice cream and they all love it!
name: I CE NY
